Visits progress through statuses (requested/triaged/assigned/in-session/completed/canceled) and maintain session artifacts like meeting URL token, start/end timestamps, device details, and connection events. The platform supports follow-ups, referrals, and care-team handoffs, plus message threads and task lists for labs/imaging orders (order metadata). Reporting endpoints summarize volume, wait times, clinician utilization, and no-show rates. All data is synthesizable: patients, queues, timings, outcomes, and billing line items.

name: MediResults Hub (Lab Orders + Results Delivery)
description: MediResults Hub is a lab integration and results portal for clinics and diagnostic centers. Staff CRUD ordering providers, facilities, patients, test catalogs (panels, components, reference ranges), specimen types, collection sites, and courier pickups. Order workflows include creating lab orders, generating requisition numbers and barcode labels, tracking specimen collection events (collected/received/in-process/resulted/rejected), and managing recollect requests with reasons. Results are stored as structured analyte records (name, value, unit, flags, reference range) plus PDF report metadata; patients can view results, acknowledge receipt, and message the care team. The platform supports standing orders, reflex testing rules (if value > threshold then add test), and result routing to multiple recipients with consent controls. Operational features include inventory of collection supplies at sites, quality incidents, turnaround-time metrics, and audit trails for edits and releases. APIs enable searching orders by patient/date, pulling result timelines, and reconciling billing codes (synthetic CPT/LOINC-like identifiers) without relying on real external content.

name: DoseTrack Pharmacy (E-Prescriptions + Fulfillment + Refills)
description: DoseTrack Pharmacy is a digital pharmacy operations platform managing prescriptions, dispensing, and patient refills. Pharmacists CRUD patients, prescribers, drug catalog items (NDC-like codes, strengths, forms), insurance profiles (metadata), allergy flags, and preferred pickup/delivery options. Prescription workflows ingest new Rx records, validate eligibility (rules-based), perform drug utilization checks (synthetic interactions), and move orders through statuses (received/under-review/ready-to-fill/filled/checked/dispensed/canceled). Dispensing records track lot numbers, expiration dates, quantities, partial fills, substitutions, and signature capture metadata. Patients request refills, manage auto-refill schedules, update addresses, and view order history and copay estimates. Delivery features include shipping label metadata, tracking numbers, temperature-control requirement flags, and proof-of-delivery events. The platform supports prior authorization cases as structured tasks (documents as metadata), refill reminders, and pharmacist-patient messaging threads. Reporting endpoints cover fill rates, turnaround times, controlled-substance counts, and inventory adjustments across locations.

name: CareHome RX Admin (Long-Term Care eMAR + Medication Cycles)
description: CareHome RX Admin is a medication administration and pharmacy coordination system for assisted living and skilled nursing facilities. Admins CRUD facilities, units, residents, medication orders, prescribers, med pass schedules, and staff roles. Medication cycles include monthly cycle fills, emergency kits, and PRN orders with rules for max doses and observation notes. The eMAR tracks scheduled administrations with timestamps, staff initials, outcomes (given/held/refused/missed), reasons, and vitals checks as structured fields. Change workflows include discontinue/hold/restart orders, dose changes with effective dates, and reconciliation after hospital returns. Pharmacy integration is modeled via purchase orders, fill batches, delivery manifests, and controlled-substance chain-of-custody logs (counts, witnessed events). The platform manages incident reports (med errors), follow-up tasks, and compliance dashboards for late/omitted doses. All artifacts are database-friendly: residents, meds, schedules, events, signatures as metadata, and audit logs. APIs support daily med pass lists, resident profiles, cycle fill generation, and reconciliation reports.

name: RentReady Marketplace (Equipment + Vehicle Rentals)
description: RentReady Marketplace is a rental platform for equipment and vehicles (tools, cameras, trailers, vans) with availability, deposits, and damage workflows. Providers CRUD listings, pricing tiers (hour/day/week), add-ons, blackout dates, pickup locations, and policies (mileage caps, cleaning fees). Renters search by category and date range, then create bookings that reserve inventory items (serialized assets) and collect deposits via payment token metadata. Booking lifecycles cover request/confirmed/picked-up/active/returned/closed/canceled with timestamps, checklists, and identity verification status (synthetic). Asset management includes condition reports at pickup/return, photos as metadata, damage claims, repair tasks, and downtime scheduling. The platform supports extensions, partial refunds, late-return penalties, and automated messaging templates between renter and provider. Fleet-style items can track odometer readings, fuel levels, and geofence zones as simple coordinates. Reporting endpoints show utilization, revenue by category, upcoming returns, and assets needing maintenance. All data is synthesizable: listings, calendars, bookings, charges, and condition events.

name: PortRoute TMS (Freight Logistics + Shipment Visibility)
description: PortRoute TMS is a transportation management system for shippers and 3PLs coordinating domestic and cross-border freight. Users CRUD customers, carriers, lanes, rate cards, accessorial charges, shipment orders, stops, commodities (weights, dimensions, hazmat flags), and required documents as metadata. Planning workflows include tendering loads to carriers, booking confirmations, appointment scheduling at facilities, and generating bills of lading and commercial invoice metadata. Execution tracks milestones (picked up/at terminal/in transit/delayed/out for delivery/delivered) with event timestamps and geolocation pings (synthetic). Exception management supports holds, damages, reweigh/reclass events, and claims with supporting attachments metadata. Billing workflows include carrier invoices, audit/approval, customer invoicing, accruals, and payment status. The platform offers ETA calculations using simple rules (distance + service level) rather than external real-time traffic. APIs allow searching shipments by reference, retrieving stop sequences, posting tracking events, and producing performance reports (on-time %, dwell time, cost per mile).

name: FleetOps Commander (Fleet Maintenance + Driver Compliance)
description: FleetOps Commander is a fleet management platform for service and delivery fleets focused on vehicles, drivers, inspections, and maintenance. Fleet admins CRUD vehicles (VIN-like IDs, make/model), devices (telematics unit metadata), drivers, assignments, routes, geofences, and maintenance schedules. Daily workflows include creating driver shifts, assigning vehicles, logging pre/post-trip inspections (checklist items, defects, photos metadata), and generating work orders for repairs. Preventive maintenance triggers by mileage/engine hours and creates tasks, parts requests, and vendor appointments. Compliance features track driver certifications, medical card expirations (dates), training records, and incident reports for collisions with structured fields. Telematics is represented as synthesized trip logs (start/end, distance, harsh events counts), fuel transactions, and odometer updates. Dispatchers can monitor vehicle status (available/on-route/out-of-service) and view alerts for overdue inspections or maintenance. APIs support vehicle timelines, defect resolution status, maintenance cost summaries, and utilization metrics without needing real GPS or sensor streams.

name: LastMile Beacon (Delivery Tracking + Proof of Delivery)
description: LastMile Beacon is a last-mile delivery platform for retailers and couriers that manages orders, routes, and delivery confirmation. Merchants CRUD stores, service zones, delivery promises, and integration keys; they create delivery orders with packages, weights, special handling flags, and customer contact preferences. Dispatchers batch orders into routes, assign to drivers, and manage capacity constraints (vehicle type, stop limits). The platform tracks status events (created/assigned/picked-up/in-transit/attempted/delivered/returned) and location pings as synthesized coordinates with timestamps. Proof-of-delivery includes signature capture metadata, photo metadata, recipient name, and delivery notes; failed deliveries log reason codes and reschedule windows. Customers receive tracking links with ETA windows computed from route sequence and service-level rules. Returns workflows support RMA references, pickup scheduling, and restocking confirmation events. Billing records store delivery fees, surcharges, tips, and driver payouts (synthetic). APIs enable posting scan events, querying driver manifests, retrieving POD artifacts metadata, and generating on-time and first-attempt success reports.

name: LeaseLens (Commercial Property Leasing CRM + Deal Room)
description: LeaseLens is a commercial real estate leasing platform for landlords, brokers, and asset managers to market spaces and manage the leasing pipeline. Admins CRUD buildings, suites/units, floorplans (metadata), amenities, asking rents, operating expenses, availability dates, and listing packages. Brokers manage prospects (tenants), contacts, requirements (square footage, use type, budget), tours, and interactions. Workflows include publishing listings to a branded portal, capturing leads via inquiry forms, scheduling tours, logging tour outcomes, generating proposals/LOIs from templates, and tracking deal stages (lead, toured, negotiating, executed, lost). Lease records store term, rent steps, concessions, deposits, and critical dates; renewals and expirations trigger tasks and alerts. Documents are handled as file metadata with versioning and access permissions for “deal rooms.” Reporting dashboards aggregate vacancy, pipeline value, time-to-lease, and broker performance. All data (properties, pricing, contacts, dates, stage history) is fully synthesizable and supports realistic CRUD-heavy API simulations.

name: StaySwap Rentals (Vacation Rental Marketplace + Host Ops)
description: StaySwap Rentals is a short-term rental marketplace focused on host operations and booking lifecycles. Hosts CRUD listings (homes/rooms), photos (metadata), house rules, fees, taxes, occupancy limits, amenities, and cancellation policies. Availability is managed via calendars with nightly rates, seasonal pricing, minimum stays, and blocked dates; bulk updates and rule-based pricing are supported. Guests search by location and dates (catalog queries), create bookings, add guests, apply coupons, and pay deposits (synthetic payment tokens). Bookings track status (inquiry, pending, confirmed, checked-in, completed, canceled), messages, special requests, and refund calculations. Operational workflows include automated pre-arrival instructions, check-in/out tasks, incident reports, damage claims, and review exchanges (ratings + short text). Vendors/cleaners can be assigned to turnovers with schedules, checklists, and completion timestamps. The platform includes a resolution center for disputes, a ledger for payouts/fees, and analytics on occupancy and revenue. Entities and events are database-friendly and can be fully faked while remaining realistic.

name: UnitLedger (Residential Property Management + Maintenance)
description: UnitLedger is a property management system for small-to-mid residential portfolios. Managers CRUD owners, properties, buildings, units, leases, tenants, rent schedules, deposits, late-fee rules, and move-in/move-out inspections (checklist items + photos metadata). Tenants submit maintenance requests with categories, priority, availability windows, and attachments; managers triage, assign vendors, and track work orders through statuses (new, scheduled, in progress, completed, billed). Rent collection supports recurring charges, partial payments, credits, and receipts (synthetic payment references), plus automated reminders and delinquency workflows. Communication features include announcements by building/unit, message threads tied to tickets or leases, and notice templates (e.g., entry notice, renewal offer). Vacancy workflows cover advertising units internally, tracking applicants, screening steps as structured flags (not actual background checks), and generating leases from templates. Accounting outputs include owner statements, vendor bills, and reconciliation logs. The platform emphasizes auditable CRUD with effective dates, role-based access, and event history suitable for robust API simulations.

name: ParkPilot (Parking Space Rentals + Access Scheduling)
description: ParkPilot is a marketplace and management tool for renting parking spaces in garages, driveways, and lots. Hosts CRUD locations, spaces (size/type), pricing rules (hourly/daily/monthly), access instructions, availability schedules, and permit requirements. Drivers create profiles, vehicles (plate, make/model), payment methods (synthetic), and bookings. Bookings support add-ons (EV charging, covered spot), recurring monthly subscriptions, and modifications (extend time, change vehicle, cancel with policy-based refunds). Access control is modeled with digital pass records (QR code token metadata), gate events (issued, scanned, failed), and enforcement workflows like issuing warnings or towing tickets (structured records). Hosts can manage occupancy dashboards, block spaces for maintenance, and assign attendants to lots with shifts and check-in/out logs. Dispute workflows track no-show claims, overstay fees, and evidence attachments (metadata). Reporting includes utilization, revenue, and peak-time heatmaps based on timestamps and locations. The domain is highly synthesizable: spaces, schedules, vehicles, prices, and event logs are all numeric/structured data ideal for CRUD APIs.

name: DockChain (Freight Shipment Management + Milestone Tracking)
description: DockChain is a logistics platform for shippers and 3PLs to plan, tender, and track shipments across modes (parcel, LTL, FTL, drayage). Users CRUD customers, facilities, lanes, carriers, service levels, rate tables, and shipment orders. A shipment includes pickup/delivery stops, time windows, references, pallets/cartons, weights/dimensions, special handling flags, and documents (BOL/POD metadata). Workflows include quoting, carrier tendering, acceptance/rejection, appointment scheduling, label generation (identifier metadata), and exception management (delay, damaged, missed pickup). Tracking is modeled with milestone events (created, picked up, in transit, at terminal, out for delivery, delivered) including timestamps, GPS pings, and status notes. Claims and returns are handled as structured cases with evidence attachments and resolution states. The system supports batch imports, webhooks for event updates, and audit trails for changes. Analytics summarize on-time performance, cost by lane, and dwell time at facilities. All entities and tracking events can be realistically synthesized without needing real-world carrier data.

name: RouteRoster (Last-Mile Delivery Dispatch + Proof of Delivery)
description: RouteRoster is a last-mile delivery dispatch system for local couriers and retailers. Dispatchers CRUD depots, drivers, vehicles, delivery zones, customers, and delivery jobs. Jobs include pickup/drop-off addresses, time windows, package count, weight, handling instructions, and COD amount (synthetic). Planning workflows include batch job creation, route optimization inputs (stop order is stored, not computed), driver assignment, and shift scheduling. Drivers use a mobile workflow to accept routes, update stop statuses (arrived, attempted, delivered, returned), capture signatures (metadata), photos (metadata), and scan parcel IDs. Exceptions include customer not home, address not found, damaged package, and re-delivery scheduling. The platform also tracks driver location pings, ETAs (stored values), and notifications to recipients via email/SMS tokens (synthetic). Billing supports per-stop pricing, surcharges, tips, and weekly settlements with dispute handling. Admin dashboards show live route progress, SLA compliance, and performance metrics like stops/hour and failed-attempt rate. The data model is CRUD-heavy with event streams perfect for API simulation.

name: FleetOps Hub (Vehicle Fleet Management + Work Orders + Fuel)
description: FleetOps Hub manages company vehicles, drivers, compliance, and maintenance operations. Fleet admins CRUD vehicles (VIN, type, capacity), assignments, odometer logs, inspection checklists, registration/insurance expirations (dates), and driver profiles with training/compliance flags. Maintenance workflows include creating service schedules (oil change intervals), generating work orders, assigning internal mechanics or vendors, tracking parts used (SKU, quantity, cost), labor entries, and completion verification. Fuel management tracks fuel transactions (station, gallons/liters, price), fuel cards (tokenized IDs), and anomaly flags (overfill, out-of-hours). Incident management stores accidents as structured reports with photos metadata, third-party info, and claim status. Telematics data is represented as periodic readings (GPS, speed, engine hours) that can be synthesized; rules can trigger alerts (geofence breach, idle time, harsh braking as scored events). Reporting includes total cost of ownership, utilization, downtime, and upcoming compliance renewals. The platform emphasizes auditable records, status transitions, and effective dates—ideal for realistic database-driven API environments.

name: Collectify Boards (Collections + Collaborative Curation)
description: Collectify Boards is a curation platform for saving and organizing items into shareable collections for teams or communities (design mood boards, product research, travel planning). Users CRUD workspaces, members, roles, boards, sections, and cards. Cards store structured metadata: title, source URL, tags, thumbnail/image metadata, short notes, pricing fields, location fields, and custom attributes defined per board. Workflows include saving via browser extension (API creates card from URL metadata fields), drag-and-drop ordering (position indexes), merging duplicates, and versioned edits with activity logs. Collaboration features include comments, reactions, mentions, and review states (draft, shortlisted, approved, archived). Users can create templates for recurring board structures and export collections as CSV/JSON or share read-only links with access controls and expiration dates. Automation rules can file new cards into sections based on tags or domains (stored rule definitions). Analytics summarize most-saved sources, tag usage, and board engagement (views, saves, comments). Everything is synthesizable: URLs, tags, positions, permissions, and short text enable strong CRUD and event-driven simulations without content-heavy requirements.

name: WishNest (Wishlists + Price Targets + Purchase Tracking)
description: WishNest is a wishlist and planning app that helps users track desired items, price targets, and gifting events. Users CRUD profiles, friends/family groups, wishlists, wishlist items, and events (birthdays, holidays, weddings). Each item contains structured fields like product name, retailer URL, category, size/color variants, desired quantity, target price, current observed price (synthetic), priority, and notes. Workflows include reserving an item (to prevent duplicate gifts), marking purchased (with optional order metadata), handling returns/exchanges, and generating thank-you lists. Price tracking is modeled with periodic snapshots and alerts when a price meets a threshold; alerts are stored as events with delivery status. Privacy controls allow per-wishlist visibility and anonymous reservations. The platform supports importing items via URL parsing (stored fields), duplicate detection, and tagging. Optional budgeting features track planned vs purchased totals per event. Reporting summarizes popular categories, savings vs target, and unfulfilled items by date. All fields are structured, numeric, or short text, making it ideal for synthesized datasets and CRUD-centric API testing.

name: EstateDocs Vault (Property Records + Renovation & Permit Tracker)
description: EstateDocs Vault is a homeowner and property team platform to organize property records and manage renovation timelines. Users CRUD properties, ownership profiles, rooms/areas, asset inventories (appliances, HVAC, roof), warranties (provider, term, expiration), contractors, and service histories. Renovation projects are tracked with phases, tasks, budgets, invoices (metadata), and change orders; each task has dependencies, due dates, assignees, and status updates. Permit tracking stores permit applications as structured records: jurisdiction, scope, submission date, inspection schedule, required documents (file metadata), and outcomes (approved, revisions required, closed). Maintenance workflows include recurring schedules (filter replacements), reminders, and inspection checklists for move-in/out or seasonal prep. Users can attach documents (titles, receipts, manuals) as metadata, categorize them, and control sharing with agents, tenants, or family via role-based permissions and time-limited links. Reporting includes upcoming expirations, budget variance, and maintenance completion rates. The platform avoids content-heavy needs while offering rich, realistic CRUD operations and lifecycle state transitions suited to API simulation.

name: RoutePilot (Last-Mile Dispatch & Proof-of-Delivery)
description: RoutePilot is a last-mile delivery operations platform for couriers and local retailers. Dispatchers CRUD delivery jobs (pickup/dropoff, time windows, service level), stops, packages (dimensions, barcode IDs), customers, delivery instructions, and driver profiles/vehicles. A routing console builds routes from jobs, assigns them to drivers, and tracks route status (planned/en-route/arrived/completed/failed). Drivers use a mobile workflow to accept routes, scan packages, capture proof-of-delivery (signature/photo metadata), record attempted-delivery reasons, and collect cash-on-delivery amounts (synthetic) with reconciliation at end of shift. The system stores GPS pings as timestamped coordinates, supports geofenced arrival events, and maintains an audit trail of status transitions. Exceptions handling includes reattempt scheduling, address corrections, customer notifications (template + delivery status events), and returns-to-sender flows. Reporting dashboards summarize on-time rate, stop duration, failed delivery reasons, and driver utilization. Admins manage depots, service zones, pricing rules (per stop, per mile), and integrations via webhook events for job created/updated, status changed, and POD captured.

name: FleetMantle (Fleet Maintenance, Inspections & Compliance)
description: FleetMantle is a fleet management system focused on asset lifecycle, maintenance scheduling, and compliance documentation. Fleet admins CRUD vehicles (VIN, make/model, telematics device IDs), drivers, assignments, odometer logs, fuel purchases (synthetic transactions), and maintenance vendors. Maintenance workflows include creating work orders with labor/parts line items, approving estimates, tracking work order status (requested/approved/in-progress/completed), and attaching receipts (file metadata). Preventive maintenance rules generate upcoming service tasks based on mileage or dates, with reminders and escalation. Inspection modules support daily DVIR-style checklists; drivers submit inspections with pass/fail items, defect notes, and photo metadata; defects automatically create repair tickets. Compliance entities include registrations, insurance policies, permits, and expiration dates with renewal tasks. Utilization and cost reporting aggregates cost per mile, downtime days, recurring defect types, and vendor performance. Role-based access separates mechanics, drivers, and managers; audit logs track edits to critical records. APIs expose vehicles, work orders, inspections, and compliance expirations for integration with dispatch or payroll.

name: DockSlotter (Warehouse Dock Appointment Scheduling)
description: DockSlotter is a dock and yard appointment platform for warehouses and distribution centers. Facility admins CRUD sites, dock doors, operating hours, capacity rules, appointment types (live unload, drop trailer, pickup), and carrier accounts. Carriers and suppliers book appointments by creating inbound/outbound loads with reference numbers, PO/ASN identifiers, trailer details, pallet/carton counts, and required equipment (liftgate, reefer). The scheduler enforces constraints (door compatibility, product handling requirements, labor capacity per hour) and supports waitlists, reschedules, and cancellations. On arrival, gate staff check in loads, assign yard locations, and move appointments through statuses (scheduled/arrived/at door/loading complete/departed/no-show). The platform tracks dwell time, late arrivals, and detention eligibility via configurable thresholds. Documents are represented as metadata (BOL, packing list) linked to appointments. Notifications are driven by event templates for confirmations, reminders, and delay alerts. Reporting includes dock utilization, no-show rate, average turn time, and carrier performance. APIs allow WMS/TMS systems to create appointments, push ASNs, and receive status webhooks.

name: ParcelClaimPro (Shipping Claims, Returns & Dispute Management)
description: ParcelClaimPro centralizes shipping exceptions for merchants managing loss, damage, and delay claims across carriers. Users CRUD carrier accounts (credentials stored as synthetic tokens), shipments, packages, declared values, and evidence items (photos/invoices as file metadata). Claims workflows let operators open cases, select claim type, enter incident details, and attach supporting documents; each case tracks status (draft/submitted/needs info/approved/denied/paid) and a timeline of communications. The system generates required forms from structured data, schedules follow-ups, and records deadlines with reminders. For returns, merchants create RMA records tied to orders/shipments with return reasons, inspection outcomes, restock disposition (restock/refurbish/discard), and refund status. A reconciliation module posts synthetic payouts to a ledger and matches them to carrier remittances. Rules engines categorize exceptions based on tracking event sequences and automatically suggest claim eligibility. Team features include assignment queues, internal notes, and role-based permissions. Reporting summarizes recovery rate, claim cycle time, denial reasons, and exception hotspots by lane, warehouse, or SKU category. APIs expose case creation, status updates, and webhook notifications when carriers request more information or a payout posts.

name: TrailTrace (Multi-Stop Shipment Tracking for B2B Freight)
description: TrailTrace is a B2B freight visibility platform for shippers coordinating multi-stop truckload and LTL moves. Operations teams CRUD customers, lanes, shipments, stops, reference numbers, and carrier/driver contacts (synthetic phone/email). Each shipment stores planned vs actual pickup/delivery times, appointment windows, commodity categories, temperature requirements, and accessorials. Tracking is modeled as event streams (created, tendered, accepted, arrived, loaded, departed, in-transit, delayed, delivered) with timestamps and optional location coordinates. Users can tender loads, receive carrier acceptance, update ETAs, and log exceptions with standardized reason codes (weather, mechanical, detention, missed appointment). Proof-of-delivery is captured as document metadata linked to the delivered stop. Collaboration features include shared shipment views with stakeholders, comment threads, and notification rules (late pickup, ETA change > X minutes). SLA dashboards compute on-time pickup/delivery rates and dwell time per facility. Admins configure event templates, business hours, and integration mappings. APIs support creating shipments, posting tracking events, subscribing to webhooks, and exporting status snapshots for customer portals or internal analytics.

name: CurateShelf (Bookmarking, Collections & Team Curation)
description: CurateShelf is a bookmarking and curation platform for individuals and teams organizing links, files, and notes into structured collections. Users CRUD bookmarks (URL, title, short description, tags), collections/folders, and collaborative workspaces. Each bookmark can store metadata (preview image URL, source domain, saved timestamp), annotations, and custom fields (priority, reading status, due date). Teams can assign bookmarks to members, create review queues, and move items through lightweight workflows (inbox → curated → published/archive). A publishing layer turns a collection into a public or private “shelf” with ordering rules and featured items. Moderation and governance features include role-based permissions, approval requirements before publishing, and audit logs for edits and deletions. Integrations allow importing/exporting from browser extensions, RSS-to-bookmark ingestion (metadata only), and webhooks for bookmark created/updated. Search is limited to user-provided fields (title/tags/notes) rather than web-wide results. Analytics track saves per collection, most-used tags, and engagement on published shelves (views, clicks). The API supports CRUD for bookmarks, collections, members, and sharing links with expiration.

name: StayHarbor (Vacation Rental Booking & Turnover Scheduling)
description: StayHarbor is a hospitality platform for small property managers handling vacation rentals. Managers CRUD properties, units, amenities, rate plans, seasonal pricing rules, minimum-stay policies, and availability calendars. Booking workflows include quotes, holds, confirmed reservations, payments (synthetic records), refunds, and cancellation policies with fee calculations. Each reservation stores guest details, occupancy counts, check-in/out times, special requests, and assigned unit. Turnover operations generate cleaning tasks between stays with checklist templates, assigned cleaners, scheduling constraints, and completion proof (photos/notes metadata). Maintenance tickets can be created from inspection findings and linked to properties with priority and status. Messaging templates support pre-arrival instructions, door-code delivery (synthetic code), and post-stay follow-ups. Channel management can be simulated via external “channels” as sources with import/export of reservations and blocked dates. Financial dashboards summarize revenue by property, occupancy rate, taxes/fees, and payouts to owners. Role-based access separates owners, staff, and contractors. APIs cover property/availability CRUD, reservation creation/modification, task status updates, and webhook events for booking confirmed/canceled and cleaning completed.

name: TableTurner (Restaurant Reservations, Waitlist & Party Notes)
description: TableTurner is a reservation and waitlist system for restaurants and small venues. Staff CRUD locations, floor plans, tables, seating areas, operating hours, and reservation rules (party size limits, deposit requirements, no-show policy). Guests create reservations with time, party size, contact info (synthetic), and preferences (high chair, allergy notes). Hosts manage a live book with statuses (booked/checked-in/seated/finished/no-show/canceled) and a waitlist that supports quoted times, SMS notifications (template-based), and priority adjustments. Table assignment workflows include combining tables, tracking turn times, and moving parties between tables. Deposits and cancellation fees are stored as payment records without needing real processing. CRM-lite features store guest profiles, visit history, tags (VIP), and notes, enabling personalized service and targeted outreach. Reporting includes covers per hour, average turn time, no-show rate, and channel source breakdown. Admins can manage staff roles, shift schedules, and note visibility. APIs expose availability queries, reservation CRUD, check-in/seating events, and webhooks for status changes for integration with POS or marketing tools.

name: ClinicClock (Multi-Provider Appointments & Intake Forms)
description: ClinicClock is an appointment scheduling platform for clinics and service providers (dental, physio, salons). Admins CRUD locations, providers, services, durations, pricing, availability templates, and appointment rules (buffers, lead time, cancellation window). Patients CRUD profiles, contact methods (synthetic), insurance metadata (optional), and saved intake forms. Booking workflows include searching provider availability, creating appointments, rescheduling, canceling, and joining waitlists for earlier slots. Each appointment tracks status (requested/confirmed/checked-in/completed/no-show), reason for visit, assigned room/resource, and reminders sent. Intake supports configurable forms (sections, questions, required fields) and document uploads as metadata; submissions are versioned and time-stamped. Front-desk tools manage daily schedules, check-in/out, and collect payments as synthetic invoices/receipts. Providers record structured notes (short fields, codes, follow-up plan) and create follow-up appointment tasks. Reporting covers utilization, cancellation rates, service mix, and referral sources. Permissions separate admin, front desk, and provider access with audit logs. APIs provide appointment CRUD, availability retrieval, form submissions, and webhook events for booking changes and reminders.

name: TripBoard (Collaborative Travel Shortlisting + Itinerary Builder)
description: TripBoard is a collaborative travel planning app focused on shortlists, curated collections, and lightweight booking handoff. Users CRUD trips, travelers, preferences (budget, neighborhoods, dates), and shared boards. Within a board, they save and organize candidates as bookmarks: flights (route, fare class, baggage rules), lodging (room type, refundable flag, amenities), activities (duration, category, meeting point), and restaurants (cuisine, price range). Items support tags, notes, votes, and “considering/selected/removed” status, plus price snapshots and timestamped change logs. Workflows include importing links into structured cards, deduplicating the same hotel/flight across sources, assigning tasks (e.g., “call hotel,” “check visa”), and generating a day-by-day itinerary with time blocks and map pins. Users can request approvals from a group, lock an itinerary version, and export confirmations as attachment metadata (PNR/confirmation numbers, vendor contact, cancellation deadlines). Admin APIs manage destinations, airport/city reference data, currency tables, and notification rules (reminders for check-in windows, payment due dates). The platform emphasizes CRUD and auditability around shortlist decisions, itinerary revisions, and traveler roles/permissions.

name: SaveShelf (Universal Bookmark Vault + Taggable Collections)
description: SaveShelf is a bookmark and curation platform for saving web items into structured lists rather than long-form content. Users CRUD collections (public/private), bookmarks, tags, and custom fields per collection (e.g., “price,” “priority,” “source,” “category”). Each bookmark stores URL, title, short excerpt, thumbnail metadata, and optional entity typing (product, place, article, video-link) without hosting media. Core operations include bulk import/export, duplicate detection, batch tagging, and moving items between lists. Workflows support “inbox to curated list” triage, review queues, and reminder schedules (“review later,” “follow up in 7 days”). Teams can share collections with role-based access (owner/editor/viewer), assign items to members, and track status (new/triaged/approved/archived). APIs enable searching by tags and fields, generating list views (sorted by price, date saved, priority), and webhook events when bookmarks are created or updated. Enterprise mode adds organization tenants, SSO-like user metadata, retention rules, and audit logs for edits. This scenario is highly synthesizable: URLs, tags, lists, timestamps, and small snippets can be faked realistically while still producing meaningful CRUD interactions.

name: StayOps (Boutique Hotel PMS Lite: Rooms, Rates, Reservations)
description: StayOps is a hospitality operations platform for small hotels and inns, centered on inventory and reservation CRUD. Staff manage properties, room types, individual rooms, rate plans, add-ons (breakfast, parking), and availability calendars. Reservations store guest profiles, party size, dates, rate plan, deposit policy, payment method token, and status (inquiry/confirmed/checked-in/checked-out/canceled/no-show). Workflows include quoting and holding a room for a limited time, taking deposits, applying promo codes, and changing stay dates with re-pricing and audit logs. Front-desk operations include check-in/out, room assignment, issuing digital key metadata, and capturing incidentals holds (synthetic). Housekeeping features CRUD task lists, room-clean status, maintenance flags, and turnaround times. Group bookings allow room blocks, pick-up tracking, and cut-off dates. Admin APIs manage taxes/fees, cancellation windows, overbooking rules, and user roles. Reporting endpoints provide occupancy, ADR, RevPAR, and revenue by channel using synthesizable numbers. This scenario is ideal for simulation because every element—rooms, calendars, rates, guests, payments metadata, and statuses—can be synthesized while preserving realistic hotel workflows and constraints.

name: SlotClinic (Appointment Scheduling + Intake Forms)
description: SlotClinic is an appointment and intake management system for clinics and service providers that need structured scheduling rather than content. Admins CRUD locations, practitioners, services (duration, buffer time, price), operating hours, and appointment rules (lead time, cancellation policy). Clients CRUD profiles, dependents, insurance metadata (plan name, member ID as synthetic), and communication preferences. Core entities include appointment slots, booked appointments, waitlist entries, and intake forms (sections, questions, required flags, validation). Workflows support self-scheduling, staff scheduling, rescheduling with conflict detection, reminders, and check-in/check-out events. Each appointment tracks status (requested/confirmed/arrived/completed/canceled/no-show), notes, attachments metadata, and billing codes (optional). The platform includes resource scheduling for rooms/equipment, plus batch-blocking for holidays and provider time off. APIs expose slot search, booking, cancellation, and webhook events for confirmations and reminders. Admin dashboards provide utilization metrics and no-show rates from synthesizable aggregates. This environment is highly suitable for database simulation: time slots, calendars, form responses, and appointment statuses are realistic to generate and support meaningful CRUD and workflow testing.

name: DriveLane Dealer CRM (Leads, Inventory, Test Drives, Deals)
description: DriveLane is a car dealership platform combining inventory management and sales workflows. Staff CRUD vehicle inventory (VIN, trim, mileage, options, photos metadata, price), supplier acquisitions, and reconditioning tasks with costs and status (queued/in-progress/ready). The CRM side manages leads, contacts, communication logs, and vehicle interests. Workflows include capturing web leads, assigning them to sales reps, scheduling test drives, and tracking pipeline stages (new/contacted/appointment/test-drive/negotiation/contracted/lost). Deal desks can create quotes, apply incentives, calculate taxes/fees, and generate finance application metadata (synthetic). Trades are modeled with appraisal records, condition reports, and offer history. The platform supports reserving vehicles, handling deposits (tokenized), and converting a deal to a sale with delivery appointments. APIs cover search/filter inventory, create/update leads, post communications, schedule events, and update deal stages with audit logs. Admin modules manage pricing rules, role permissions, and location-level settings. This scenario is rich for simulation because vehicles, leads, appointments, and pricing/fee calculations can be synthesized while retaining realistic dealer operations.

name: ServiceBay Scheduler (Auto Repair Appointments + Work Orders)
description: ServiceBay is an automotive service scheduling and shop workflow platform. Customers CRUD vehicles (year/make/model, VIN synthetic), preferred shops, and appointment requests. Shops CRUD service catalogs (oil change, brakes), labor rates, technician rosters, bays, operating hours, and capacity rules. The core workflow converts an appointment into a work order containing customer concerns, inspection checklists, labor line items, parts line items, and approvals. Work orders track status (scheduled/checked-in/diagnosing/awaiting approval/in progress/ready/closed) with timestamps for SLA metrics. Estimates can be generated, revised, and approved/declined; approvals are recorded per line item. Additional features include tire storage records, loaner vehicle scheduling, and notifications for status changes. Payments are represented by invoice records, discounts, taxes, and payment tokens (no real processing required). APIs expose slot availability, appointment booking, work order CRUD, estimate approvals, technician assignment, and event streams for status updates. This platform is ideal for synthesis: schedules, parts usage, labor hours, and status transitions provide complex, realistic database interactions without requiring external content or live data.

name: PartsLedger (Auto Parts Inventory + Supplier Purchasing)
description: PartsLedger is a parts inventory and purchasing system tailored to automotive shops and small distributors. Users CRUD parts (SKU, OEM number, compatibility tags, bin location), warehouses, stock lots, and reorder rules (min/max, safety stock). Inventory movements are first-class records: receipts, adjustments, transfers, returns, and cycle counts with user attribution and timestamps. The purchasing workflow includes supplier records, price lists, purchase orders, backorders, and receiving with partial shipments. Sales/usage can be modeled through work-order consumption or counter-sales tickets, generating pick lists and decrementing stock. The platform tracks core charges (for remanufactured parts), warranty periods, and serialized items (e.g., batteries) where applicable. APIs support querying on-hand/available quantities, reserving stock for a work order, releasing reservations, and generating reorder suggestions. Admin features include user roles, location permissions, and audit trails for all quantity changes. This scenario is highly synthesizable: part master data, quantities, costs, lots, and movements can be generated realistically, enabling robust CRUD, concurrency (reservations), and reporting tests.

name: CampSpotter (Outdoor Booking: Campsites, Permits, Add-ons)
description: CampSpotter is a reservation platform for campgrounds and outdoor facilities. Operators CRUD parks, campsite listings, site attributes (RV length, hookups, accessibility), seasonal rate tables, blackout dates, and add-ons (firewood, equipment rental). Availability is modeled as a calendar per site with capacity and minimum-stay rules. Guests CRUD profiles, vehicles, party members, and bookings. Bookings track site, dates, occupancy, add-ons, fees/taxes, and status (hold/confirmed/checked-in/canceled). Workflows include creating a temporary hold during checkout, applying promo codes, enforcing cancellation/refund policies, and moving a reservation to a different site with repricing. Permit-like documents are represented as structured metadata (permit ID, conditions, issue date) rather than content-heavy files. Check-in tools support QR code metadata and ranger notes. APIs provide search by date range and constraints, booking CRUD, add-on management, and webhook events for confirmations and cancellations. Operator dashboards show occupancy and revenue summaries based on synthesizable numbers. The domain is ideal for simulation because sites, calendars, rules, and reservations are data-centric and can be faked while remaining realistic.

name: CityPass Curator (Attraction Lists + Timed Entry Reservations)
description: CityPass Curator is a curation and booking hybrid for attractions and experiences with timed entry. Editors/admins CRUD cities, venues, attractions, ticket types, blackout rules, and time-slot inventories. Users create curated lists (e.g., “Weekend in Chicago”), bookmark attractions, add notes, rank priorities, and share lists with collaborators. Booking flows let users reserve timed slots for items in their list, store attendee details, and manage confirmations (QR code metadata, order numbers). Entities include passes, entitlements (what a pass includes), reservations, and redemption events (unused/redeemed/expired) with timestamps. Workflows support building an itinerary from a curated list, enforcing capacity limits, rescheduling within policy, and bundling multiple reservations under a trip. Partner management includes vendor profiles, settlement reports (synthetic amounts), and dispute records for failed redemptions. APIs cover attraction catalog browsing, list CRUD, slot availability queries, reservation creation/cancel, and redemption posting. This scenario fits synthesis well: attractions, schedules, capacities, tickets, and redemption statuses are all structured data that can be generated realistically for end-to-end API simulation.

name: FormForge Cloud (Conditional Forms + Approvals)
description: FormForge Cloud is a form builder and workflow platform for teams that need structured data intake with approvals. Admins CRUD workspaces, users/roles, form templates, sections, fields (type, validation, conditional logic), scoring rules, and reusable option lists. Teams publish forms to share links or embed widgets, then manage submissions as records with statuses (new/in-review/approved/rejected/needs-info). Each submission stores respondent details (synthetic), timestamps, field answers, attachments (file metadata), and an audit trail of edits. Workflow features include assignment queues, internal comments, @mentions, SLAs, and routing rules based on responses (e.g., route to Legal if “contract value” exceeds threshold). Approvers can request changes, add decision notes, and apply e-sign acknowledgements. Reporting supports exports, dashboards by form/version, and data retention rules. APIs cover template versioning, submission ingestion, webhooks for status changes, and integration to create downstream objects (tickets, CRM leads, onboarding cases).

name: PulseBack (Multi-Channel Feedback & Resolution Tracking)
description: PulseBack is a feedback collection and resolution system for products, facilities, and services. Teams CRUD feedback sources (QR posters, email links, in-app widgets), surveys (CSAT/NPS/CES), question banks, targeting rules, and incentive campaigns (synthetic coupons). Incoming feedback becomes a case with structured fields (category, location, product, severity, sentiment tag), free-text comments (short), and optional attachments (metadata). Agents triage cases with statuses (new/acknowledged/in-progress/waiting/closed), assign owners, set due dates, and link related cases to spot recurring issues. Workflows include requesting follow-up from the submitter, logging corrective actions, and capturing resolution codes for analytics. Role-based access controls segment data by site/region. The platform supports deduplication rules, escalation policies, and audit logs for compliance. APIs allow creating feedback events, updating case status, posting internal notes, managing tags, and exporting datasets. Dashboards summarize trends by category and time window using fully synthesizable metrics.

name: GrantGate (Application Intake + Review Panels)
description: GrantGate is an application portal for grants, scholarships, and internal funding programs. Program managers CRUD programs, eligibility rules, application forms, required documents (metadata), scoring rubrics, review rounds, and reviewer panels. Applicants create profiles (identity/contact fields), start applications, save drafts, upload supporting files (metadata), and submit before deadlines. Each application is a record with sections, responses, budget line items (synthetic numbers), and status (draft/submitted/eligible/ineligible/under-review/awarded/declined). Review workflows assign applications to reviewers with blind/unblind settings, conflict-of-interest declarations, scoring and comments, and consensus meetings with final decisions. Managers can request clarifications, issue award letters (templated text), and track disbursement schedules as synthetic payment milestones. The system maintains an audit trail of edits, decisions, and communications. APIs cover applicant onboarding, application CRUD, document checklist validation, reviewer assignment, scoring submission, and program reporting (pipeline counts, average scores, award totals).

name: ClubReg Hub (Membership Registration + Renewals)
description: ClubReg Hub is a registration and membership management platform for clubs, associations, and youth programs. Administrators CRUD organizations, membership tiers, fee schedules, custom registration forms, waivers, discount codes (synthetic), and season configurations. Members create accounts, register themselves and dependents, upload verification documents (metadata), and sign waivers with timestamped acknowledgements. Each registration generates records for member profiles, memberships (active/past-due/expired), invoices (synthetic payments), and eligibility flags. Workflows include approval queues for manual vetting, waitlists when capacity is reached, automated renewal reminders, and proration logic for mid-season joins. Staff can assign members to teams/groups, track attendance check-ins for events, and manage communications via templated emails/SMS (synthetic). Reporting includes roster exports, revenue summaries, and compliance checklists (e.g., background-check status fields as synthetic). APIs support registration submission, membership lifecycle updates, invoice generation, webhook notifications for approvals, and roster synchronization to external systems.

name: ClinicoCal (Scheduling + Intake Packets for Clinics)
description: ClinicoCal is a scheduling and intake platform for small clinics and therapy practices. Staff CRUD providers, services, appointment types, clinic locations/rooms, availability rules, blackout dates, and insurance plans (as structured metadata). Patients create accounts, request appointments, complete intake forms, and upload documents (metadata). Appointments are records with status (requested/confirmed/checked-in/completed/canceled/no-show), reminders, and associated forms. Workflows include waitlist management, automated rescheduling links, pre-visit checklists, and provider assignment rules. Front desk users can manage daily calendars, move appointments between rooms/providers, record check-in timestamps, and capture co-pay as a synthetic transaction. Providers can add structured visit notes (short fields), tasks (follow-up call, referral), and send secure messages. The system maintains audit logs and configurable retention policies. APIs cover availability queries, appointment CRUD, patient intake submission, status webhooks, and exports for billing systems (without needing real claims processing). All operational data (times, providers, statuses, fees) is synthesizable.

name: VenueOps Scheduler (Event Runsheets + Staff Rosters)
description: VenueOps Scheduler is an event operations platform for venues managing multiple bookings and on-site logistics. Managers CRUD venues, spaces/rooms, equipment inventory (AV, staging), service packages, rate cards, and staffing roles. Clients or sales reps create event holds, convert to confirmed events, and maintain event details (guest count, schedule blocks, layout, catering notes as short text). Each event includes a runsheet timeline with tasks, dependencies, and assigned staff/contractors. Resource booking prevents double-booking of rooms and equipment; conflicts trigger alerts and alternative suggestions based on capacity rules. Workflows include approvals for change requests, deposit and installment invoices (synthetic), and day-of checklists with completion statuses. Staff roster management tracks shifts, call times, and acknowledgements. After the event, teams log incident reports, damages (synthetic costs), and post-event feedback forms. APIs support searching availability, creating holds, updating event schedules, reserving equipment, managing task checklists, and generating operational exports for printing or third-party payroll.

name: LabBench Booker (Shared Resource & Equipment Reservations)
description: LabBench Booker is a resource booking system for shared labs, makerspaces, and university cores. Admins CRUD facilities, equipment assets (model, serial, calibration dates), booking policies (training required, max hours), maintenance windows, and user roles (student, staff, external). Users request reservations with time slots, purpose codes, project IDs, and required accessories; bookings are records with statuses (requested/approved/confirmed/in-use/completed/canceled). The platform enforces constraints such as certifications, buffer times, capacity limits, and conflict checks. Workflows include approval queues, usage check-in/out, incident logs (damage, errors), and automated billing as synthetic usage charges based on hourly rates and consumables. Maintenance workflows track service tickets, parts line items (synthetic), and downtime flags that block new reservations. Reporting includes utilization rates, no-show counts, and cost recovery summaries. APIs cover availability calendars, booking CRUD, policy validation, check-in events, usage metering submissions (synthetic readings), and webhook notifications to sync with campus systems.

name: PolicyProof (Compliance Attestations + Evidence Register)
description: PolicyProof is a compliance management portal for collecting attestations, managing controls, and tracking evidence. Compliance admins CRUD frameworks (SOC 2, ISO-like templates), control catalogs, policies, attestation campaigns, evidence types, and user roles (owner, approver, auditor). Control owners receive tasks to submit attestations (yes/no + short notes) and upload evidence artifacts (file metadata, links, expiration dates). Each control has a lifecycle status (not-started/in-progress/ready/needs-remediation/approved) and an audit trail of changes, comments, and approvals. Workflows include recurring schedules, reminders, escalation paths, and exceptions management with risk ratings (synthetic scores), mitigation plans, and due dates. The system supports evidence re-use across periods, sampling rules, and read-only auditor portals with scoped access. APIs allow creating controls, assigning tasks, posting attestations, attaching evidence metadata, and exporting audit packs as structured lists. All content is structured and synthesizable: dates, owners, statuses, risk levels, and evidence references.

name: SignFlow Rooms (Document Signing + Template Packets)
description: SignFlow Rooms is an e-signature and document packet routing platform for HR, sales, and operations teams. Admins CRUD templates, fields (signature, initials, date, checkbox, short text), signer roles, routing order, and reusable document packets (offer letter + policy acknowledgements). Users create signature requests, add recipients (synthetic identities), set authentication methods (email code, SMS code as synthetic), and send for signing. Each envelope tracks recipients, per-signer status (sent/viewed/signed/declined/expired), reminders, and a timestamped audit log. Workflows include conditional documents (include NDA only if “contractor” is selected), delegation, bulk sends for policy updates, and countersigning. Completed envelopes produce a completion certificate record and immutable final file metadata. Team dashboards show throughput, cycle times, and outstanding signatures. APIs support template management, envelope creation, recipient updates, signing events via webhooks, and retrieval of audit trails and completion status. All key data—participants, fields, timestamps, and state transitions—is fully synthesizable.

name: ClinicRoster HQ (Provider Scheduling + Patient Appointment Flow)
description: ClinicRoster HQ is a scheduling and calendar platform for multi-provider clinics that need structured appointment management without heavy clinical content. Admins CRUD locations, departments, providers, provider credentials, appointment types (duration, prep time, buffers), and availability templates (weekly schedules, exceptions, holidays). Front-desk teams CRUD patient profiles (demographics, contact info, insurance placeholders), referrals, appointments, and waitlists. Booking workflows support creating holds, confirming appointments, rescheduling, cancellations with rules, and automated reminders (message logs + delivery status). The system models visit statuses (scheduled/checked-in/in-room/completed/no-show) and tracks room/resource assignments (exam rooms, equipment) to prevent conflicts. Optional intake forms are represented as structured question/answer sets and completion timestamps. Billing is simulated as invoice headers, line items, and payment records (no real processing), enabling reporting on utilization, no-show rates, and provider capacity. APIs include availability search, appointment CRUD, check-in/out events, and audit logs for compliance-sensitive actions.

name: VenuePulse (Event Production Runsheets + Staff & Vendor Coordination)
description: VenuePulse is an event management platform for production teams coordinating schedules, resources, and vendors across one or many venues. Users CRUD organizations, venues, spaces/rooms, event templates, events, sessions, and detailed run-of-show items (cues) with timestamps, owners, and dependencies. Resource booking is first-class: teams CRUD equipment inventory (AV gear, staging, lighting), rentals, labor roles, and staffing shifts, then assign them to events and time blocks with conflict detection. Vendor workflows include creating vendor profiles, issuing purchase orders (synthetic), tracking deliveries, and managing COIs as document metadata with expiration dates. Attendee management stays lightweight: ticket types, registration records, check-in states, and badge fields. Collaboration features include task lists, approvals, versioned schedules, and change notices (what changed, who approved, when it was communicated). APIs support retrieving live schedules by venue/day, posting schedule updates, recording check-in counts, and exporting operational manifests for onsite teams.

name: CourtComply Tracker (Case Deadlines + Compliance Task Calendaring)
description: CourtComply Tracker is a legal/compliance calendaring platform for law firms and in-house teams to manage matters, obligations, and filing deadlines. Users CRUD clients, matters, courts/jurisdictions (static reference tables), parties, counsel contacts, and key dates. Deadline workflows let staff create trigger-based schedules (e.g., “X days after service date”), apply jurisdiction rule sets (configurable offsets), and generate a deadline calendar with reminders and escalation paths. Each obligation is a record with owner, priority, evidence requirements, and status (open/in-progress/submitted/accepted/rejected/waived). Document handling is metadata-focused: users attach pleadings, correspondence, and exhibits as file records with versioning, sign-off status, and who reviewed. Teams can assign tasks to paralegals/attorneys, track time entries (synthetic), and maintain an audit log of edits for defensibility. Reporting includes upcoming deadlines by matter, missed-deadline risk, and workload by user. APIs provide matter CRUD, deadline generation, task assignment, and event feeds for calendar integrations.

name: ClauseForge CLM (Contract Lifecycle Management + Approvals)
description: ClauseForge CLM is a contract management system focused on structured data and repeatable workflows rather than long narrative content. Legal ops teams CRUD contract types, clause libraries (short clause text + parameters), templates, counterparties, and contract records with key fields (term dates, renewal rules, governing law, payment terms as structured values). Drafting workflows are modeled as assembling templates + selected clauses, generating versions, and routing internal approvals (reviewers, required steps, SLA timers). Negotiation is tracked via issue lists (topic, proposed position, status), redline/version metadata, and comment threads. Execution is simulated with signature packets, signer roles, signing order, and signed-status events (sent/viewed/signed/declined/expired) while storing documents as file metadata. Post-signing includes obligation tracking (deliverables, notice dates), renewal alerts, and amendment workflows linked to parent contracts. Integrations are API-friendly: create contracts from intake forms, update statuses, fetch renewal queues, and produce dashboards for cycle time, bottlenecks, and contract inventory.

name: CampusLMS Studio (Courses + Assignments + Gradebook)
description: CampusLMS Studio is a learning management system centered on structured course operations. Instructors CRUD courses, sections, modules, lessons (short descriptions), assignments, quizzes (question banks with item types), rubrics, and grade categories. Students CRUD profiles, enrollments, submissions (file metadata + timestamps), and discussion participation (short posts/comments). Workflows include publishing/unpublishing content, scheduling release dates, accepting late work with penalty rules, grading submissions (scores, rubric criteria, feedback snippets), and returning grades. The gradebook supports overrides, regrade requests, and audit logs of score changes. Attendance is modeled through sessions and presence statuses. Course communications are simulated via announcements, message threads, and notification preferences. Admins manage academic terms, course catalogs, SIS-like import jobs (synthetic), and role permissions. Reporting includes learner progress, missing assignments, and engagement metrics (views, submission counts). APIs enable course provisioning, roster sync, assignment CRUD, submission upload endpoints, grading actions, and read-only analytics exports.

name: CertTrack Academy (Certification Programs + Proctored Exam Scheduling)
description: CertTrack Academy is a certification and training platform for professional programs that require controlled exams and credential issuance. Program managers CRUD certification tracks, prerequisites, course units, practice assessments, and exam forms (question sets + scoring rules). Candidates CRUD profiles, enrollments, identity attributes (synthetic), and eligibility documents (file metadata). Exam scheduling supports selecting a testing window, booking a slot at a test center or online proctor session, and enforcing capacity limits and blackout dates. Exam attempts track status (scheduled/checked-in/in-progress/submitted/voided), timing, and score outcomes. Proctor workflows include assigning proctors, recording incidents, and approving/invalidating attempts. Credential workflows issue digital certificates (IDs, issue/expiry dates), renewal requirements, continuing education credits, and revocation/suspension statuses. Notifications and reminders are modeled as message logs. APIs include eligibility checks, slot search, booking/attempt events, score posting, credential verification endpoints, and audit logs suitable for compliance-style simulations.

name: PolicyBinder GRC (Policies, Controls, Evidence + Attestations)
description: PolicyBinder GRC is a governance, risk, and compliance platform for managing policy documents and control evidence with calendar-driven review cycles. Admins CRUD frameworks (SOC 2, ISO-like templates as reference), controls, risks, assets/systems, and owners. Policy records store metadata (title, version, effective date, next review date, approver) and link to controls; documents are stored as file metadata with versioning and approval steps. Evidence collection is structured: evidence requests, due dates, assignees, evidence items (files/links), validation status, and reviewer comments. Attestation workflows let employees complete periodic acknowledgments (who attested, when, status), with exceptions and follow-up tasks. The system supports audit engagements by creating audits, scoping controls, generating request lists, and tracking auditor Q&A tickets. Dashboards show overdue evidence, upcoming reviews, and control coverage. APIs cover control/policy CRUD, evidence request lifecycle, attestation submissions, and exports for audit packets and compliance reporting.

name: PolicyPulse (Compliance Policy & Attestation Hub)
description: PolicyPulse helps companies manage internal compliance policies, training acknowledgments, and periodic attestations. Admins CRUD policy documents (title, version, effective date, owner), categories (security, HR, finance), controls, distribution groups, attestation campaigns, and employee profiles. Workflows include publishing a new policy version, scheduling an attestation window, assigning required readers, and tracking completion status (not started/in progress/attested/overdue/exempt). Each attestation captures a structured response (accept/decline, reason code, timestamp), plus optional exception requests that route to approvers. The system maintains a policy version history, read receipts, and an audit trail suitable for SOC 2/ISO 27001 evidence. API operations support reminders, escalation rules, and exporting evidence packages (metadata + links). Dashboards summarize compliance rates by department, policy, and time period; administrators can generate synthetic findings and remediation tasks linked to specific controls. All data is realistic to synthesize: employees, policies, statuses, due dates, and compliance metrics.

name: VendorVet (Third-Party Risk & Due Diligence Manager)
description: VendorVet is a third-party risk management platform for onboarding and monitoring vendors. Procurement and security teams CRUD vendors, vendor contacts, services provided, data types handled (PII/PCI/PHI flags), risk assessments, questionnaires (structured questions), evidence requests (file metadata), and review tasks. Onboarding workflows create an intake record, send a questionnaire, request documents (SOC 2 report metadata, insurance certificate metadata), and calculate a synthetic risk score based on answers and service criticality. Reviews move through states (invited/submitted/under review/approved/approved with conditions/rejected) with comment threads and internal approvals. VendorVet also tracks contracts linked to vendors (start/end, renewal, termination clauses as tags), monitoring schedules (annual review dates), and incidents (security event tickets with severity and resolution). The API supports reminders, SLA timers for reviews, and webhooks for “questionnaire submitted” or “evidence approved.” Reports cover vendor inventory, risk distribution, upcoming renewals, and overdue assessments—ideal for database-driven simulation.

name: LexDocket (Matter, Deadline & Filing Tracker)
description: LexDocket is a legal operations portal for managing matters, tasks, deadlines, and court filings across a firm or in-house team. Users CRUD clients, matters, parties, attorneys, billing roles, task lists, deadlines (with jurisdiction and rule type tags), and filing records (document metadata, filing fee amounts, confirmation numbers). Workflows include opening a new matter, assigning a team, generating a deadline schedule from a rule set (synthetic), and tracking task status (planned/in progress/blocked/completed). Filing workflows capture draft → review → approved → filed states, with checklists and required fields (court, case number, service method, served parties). Time entries can be modeled as structured logs (duration, activity code, rate) without narrative-heavy content. The API supports reminders for approaching deadlines, conflict-check flags, and producing “matter snapshots” for reporting. Dashboards show upcoming deadlines, workload by attorney, and filing success rates—highly suitable for synthesized entities, timestamps, and status transitions.

name: CourseDock (Cohort-Based Learning & Assignments)
description: CourseDock is a cohort-based course platform for instructors running scheduled classes with assignments and grades. Admins and instructors CRUD courses, cohorts, modules, lessons (short descriptions), enrollments, assignments, submissions (file metadata or links), rubrics, grades, and discussion threads with short posts. Workflows include publishing a cohort schedule, enrolling learners (manual, invite links, or CSV import), releasing weekly modules, and collecting submissions by due dates. Grading supports rubric criteria scores, late penalties, re-submissions, and feedback stored as structured fields (score, tags, brief comments). Attendance and live session records are modeled as meeting instances with join times and participation flags (synthetic). The API enables progress tracking (lesson completion, assignment status), certificates of completion generation, and automated reminders for overdue work. Instructors can manage TAs, permissions, and office-hour slots. Reports include completion rates, average scores per cohort, and engagement metrics—entirely database-driven and realistic with synthesized users, schedules, and grades.

name: TutorLoop (Tutoring Marketplace & Session Management)
description: TutorLoop connects students with tutors and manages scheduling, session notes, and payments (as synthetic transactions). Users CRUD tutor profiles (subjects, rates, availability), student profiles, lesson packages, bookings, session records, invoices, and review ratings. The marketplace workflow supports requesting a tutor, issuing quotes (hourly or package), confirming a schedule, and running recurring sessions. Each session stores time, duration, subject, materials (links/file metadata), and structured outcomes (topics covered, homework assigned, next steps). Tutors track availability blocks and time-off; students can reschedule, cancel under policy rules, or request refunds (status-based). Admin tools handle disputes, tutor verification statuses, and payout batches. API endpoints support calendar syncing via tokens (simulated), reminder notifications, and metrics dashboards (utilization, no-show rates, revenue by subject). Data is easily synthesized: user entities, schedules, prices, ratings, and session outcomes without requiring long-form educational content.

name: VetLedger (Veterinary Clinic Appointments & Medical Records)
description: VetLedger is a practice management system for veterinary clinics handling appointments, patient records, and billing. Staff CRUD clients, pets (species, breed, DOB, weight), appointments, visit notes (structured fields), diagnoses (codes/tags), vaccinations, lab orders/results (numeric values), prescriptions, and invoices. Workflows include booking appointments with reason codes, checking in pets, recording vitals, creating treatment plans, and generating itemized invoices (services, meds, discounts, taxes). Inventory for medications and supplies can be tracked via stock levels, reorder points, and lot/expiration metadata. Follow-ups and reminders manage vaccine due dates and chronic care plans, with statuses (scheduled/completed/overdue). The API supports importing clients, exporting medical summaries, and role-based access controls for vets vs. receptionists. All key data—measurements, schedules, products, quantities, and statuses—can be synthesized realistically while still enabling rich CRUD and transactional flows.

name: PawStay Exchange (Pet Sitting & Boarding Operations)
description: PawStay Exchange is a pet sitting and boarding platform for independent sitters and small facilities. Users CRUD sitter profiles, services (drop-in, overnight, daycare), service areas (zip codes), availability calendars, pet profiles (temperament flags, meds schedule), booking requests, confirmed bookings, checklists, and incident reports. Booking workflows include requesting dates, accepting/declining, collecting deposits (synthetic), managing cancellations with fee rules, and sending check-in updates as structured logs (time, activity type, photos as metadata). Sitters track daily schedules, key pickup/dropoff events, feeding/medication tasks with completion timestamps, and add-on charges (extra walks, holiday rates). Facilities can manage capacity by kennel/room, vaccination requirements, and intake forms. Reviews and ratings are stored as numeric scores with short comments. Admin endpoints support dispute cases and refund adjustments. The model is highly database-driven and realistic without needing content-heavy media.

name: PawPantry Pro (Pet Supplies Subscription & Inventory)
description: PawPantry Pro is a pet supplies e-commerce platform focused on recurring subscriptions (food, litter, supplements) and household replenishment. Users CRUD customer accounts, pet profiles (diet, weight range, allergies), products (brand, size, nutrition tags), bundles, carts, orders, shipments, and subscription plans (cadence, next ship date, pause/skip). Workflows include building a pet-specific plan, applying coupons, placing one-time orders, starting subscriptions, handling address changes, and processing returns/refunds (synthetic transactions). Inventory is tracked across warehouses with stock counts, reorder thresholds, and backorder statuses; fulfillment chooses shipping method and generates tracking numbers (synthetic). The API supports price tiers, tax/shipping calculations, order status transitions (paid/picked/packed/shipped/delivered/returned), and customer support cases tied to orders. Reporting covers churn, upcoming subscription shipments, and out-of-stock forecasts—ideal for synthesized entities, quantities, timestamps, and transactional states.

name: CohortCampus (Cohort-Based Course Delivery + Assessments)
description: CohortCampus is a cohort-based learning platform for running structured courses with live sessions, assignments, and progress tracking. Admins CRUD organizations, courses, cohorts, lessons/modules, session schedules, instructors, and enrollment rules (seat limits, prerequisites, coupon codes). Learners browse a catalog, enroll, and manage profiles, time zones, notification preferences, and saved courses. Each cohort includes a roster, attendance records, discussion threads (short posts), assignment submissions (file metadata + links), rubric-based grades, and feedback comments. Workflows include publishing a course version, opening/closing enrollment, waitlisting and promotion, issuing completion certificates, and handling withdrawals/refunds (synthetic payment records). Instructors manage office hours slots, create quizzes from question banks (MCQ/short answer), set due dates and late policies, and export gradebooks. The platform supports learning analytics as structured metrics (module completion, time-on-task estimates, quiz scores), cohort announcements, and integrations via API for SSO, provisioning users, and syncing enrollments. All data is easily synthesizable: users, courses, schedules, grades, submissions, and completion states.

name: LabPracticum LMS (Skills Checklists + Clinical Rotations)
description: LabPracticum LMS is designed for vocational programs that require supervised skills and rotation tracking (nursing, EMT, dental assisting). Program admins CRUD programs, cohorts, competency frameworks, skills checklists, clinical sites, supervisors/preceptors, and rotation templates (hours required, allowed dates, capacity). Students manage profiles, certifications (type, expiration), immunization records (metadata), and rotation preferences. Core workflows include requesting a rotation slot, supervisor approval, logging shift hours, and recording skill attempts with outcomes (observed/pass/fail/needs practice), notes, and timestamps. Instructors can schedule evaluation visits, complete structured evaluations (rating scales), create remediation plans with tasks and deadlines, and track completion. The system maintains audit trails for who signed off each skill, versioned checklists per term, and compliance dashboards (hours remaining, missing documents, expiring certs). APIs support importing students from SIS, exporting hours to accrediting reports, and syncing sites/capacities. Everything is database-driven: sites, rotations, approvals, hours, skill validations, and compliance status values.

name: ExamForge (Question Bank + Secure Testing + Proctor Logs)
description: ExamForge is an assessment platform for schools and certification providers focused on test creation and delivery. Authors CRUD question banks, question items (type, difficulty, tags, correct answers), media references (image/file metadata), and item versions. Exam admins CRUD exams, sections, randomization rules, time limits, scoring models, accommodations, and delivery windows. Candidates are enrolled into sittings with seat assignments (for test centers) or remote sessions. During delivery, the system records structured events: start/submit timestamps, answer selections, autosave checkpoints, pauses, and violations. Proctors manage rosters, check-in status, identity verification steps (metadata), incident reports, and room notes. After completion, workflows include auto-scoring, manual review queues, score release, retake eligibility, and certificate issuance. Reporting includes item analysis metrics (p-values, discrimination) and cohort score distributions using fully synthesizable numbers. APIs support importing candidates, pulling results, and posting completion events to an LMS or HR system. The platform is CRUD-heavy with clear entities and state transitions.

name: PetCare Booker (Pet Sitting + Walks + Care Plans)
description: PetCare Booker is a pet services scheduling platform for independent sitters and small agencies. Owners CRUD households, pets (species, breed, weight, behavior notes), veterinary contacts, vaccination records (dates/expiry), medications (dosage, schedule), and care instructions. Sitters CRUD service offerings (walk, drop-in, overnight), coverage areas, availability calendars, and pricing rules (holiday rates, additional pets). Booking workflows include quote requests, acceptance, service agreements, deposits (synthetic payments), and recurring schedules.
