Messaging includes automated reminders (renewal, expiring credits) and support threads with staff. Entities include organizations, locations, plans, members, subscriptions, invoices, payments, entitlements, usage, and notification schedules—ideal for API simulation and database-driven state transitions.

name: ReleaseNotes Hub (Product Updates + Subscriber Lists)
description: ReleaseNotes Hub is a lightweight product update and announcement system designed around structured changelogs, not long editorial posts. Product teams CRUD products, environments (web/iOS/android), and releases (version, release date, status, tags like bugfix/feature/security). Each release contains items (short title, category, affected modules, link to ticket ID, risk level). Users can subscribe to products and choose delivery preferences (email digest, webhook, RSS token). Workflows include: draft release → internal review/approval → schedule publish → notify subscribers → track acknowledgments for critical updates (ack status per user). Teams can maintain subscriber segments (customer tier, region) and target specific releases. Messaging includes comment threads on releases for internal discussion and a customer-facing feedback form that creates structured tickets (type, severity, short description). Admins manage access control, API keys, and rate limits. Entities are clean: products, releases, release_items, subscriptions, segments, notifications, acknowledgments, and feedback tickets.

name: CourseKit Collections (Learning Resource Playlists + Cohort Messaging)
description: CourseKit Collections organizes digital learning resources as curated playlists for cohorts, without hosting full course videos. Instructors CRUD cohorts, modules, and resource items (link, title, estimated duration, difficulty, prerequisites tags, completion requirements). Learners CRUD profiles, progress records (started/completed timestamps), bookmarks, and personal notes (bounded text). Workflows: instructor drafts syllabus → publishes to cohort → learners complete items → quizzes as structured checks (multiple-choice with stored answers) → instructor reviews cohort analytics (completion rates, time-to-complete). Messaging includes module discussion threads, direct instructor messaging, and announcements with read receipts. A lightweight assignment tracker supports submissions as URL/file metadata, rubrics with numeric scores, and feedback comments. The platform also supports resource “collections” that can be reused across cohorts and versioned over time. Admin features include enrollment management, invites, role assignments (TA), and content access windows. Entities are fully synthesizable: cohorts, enrollments, modules, resources, progress, bookmarks, notes, discussions, assignments, grades, and notifications.

name: GearSwap Rentals
description: GearSwap Rentals is a peer-to-peer rental marketplace for outdoor and camera equipment (tents, backpacks, drones, lenses). Renters browse listings with structured filters (category, location radius, price/day, deposit required, availability calendar) and submit booking requests. Core entities are users, identity/verification records, listings (specs, condition, photos metadata, replacement value), pricing rules (daily/weekly, add-ons, late fees), and availability blocks. Booking workflows track statuses (requested/approved/paid/picked_up/in_use/returned/inspection/closed) and support security deposits with partial/total release after inspection. Lenders manage inventory quantities, blackout dates, pickup options, and damage policies; they can approve/decline requests, message renters, and log check-in/check-out condition reports (checklist items, notes, damage codes). The platform supports disputes (claim, evidence attachments metadata, resolution), refunds, and penalties. Ratings and reviews are tied to completed bookings. Admin tools include category management, location zones, fee schedules, and risk flags. All operational data—inventory, prices, calendars, bookings, deposits, inspections, and dispute outcomes—can be synthesized deterministically for API testing.

name: BargainBid Auctions
description: BargainBid Auctions is an online auction platform for liquidation and surplus goods (electronics lots, tools, returned merchandise). Sellers create auction events and lots with structured attributes (brand, condition grade, manifest fields, reserve price, shipping class, pickup window). Buyers register, store payment methods, set bidder profiles, and place bids or max-bids. Key entities include auctions, lots, bids, proxy rules, watchlists, invoices, and fulfillment records. Workflows cover auction lifecycle (draft/scheduled/live/extended/closed/settled) with anti-sniping extensions, bid validation rules, and real-time-like state transitions driven by timestamps. After close, the system generates invoices with buyer premiums, taxes, and shipping estimates; payments move through statuses (pending/authorized/captured/failed/refunded). Fulfillment supports either local pickup (appointment slots, check-in QR metadata) or shipping (labels, carrier service level, tracking numbers). Sellers and admins reconcile payouts: fees, adjustments, chargebacks, and holdbacks. Disputes and returns are modeled per lot with reason codes and resolutions. The platform is database-centric with fully synthesizable bids, closing times, financial ledgers, and shipment status updates.

name: WholesaleHub Pro
description: WholesaleHub Pro is a B2B wholesale ordering portal for retailers sourcing from distributors (cases, pallets, minimum order quantities). Buyers (stores) CRUD company profiles, locations, tax exemptions, purchasing roles, and saved carts. Distributors CRUD catalogs with SKUs, tiered pricing, case packs, lead times, and warehouse-specific stock. Ordering is quote-driven: buyers create RFQs (requested SKUs/quantities, target delivery date), distributors respond with quotes (price tiers, substitutions, freight terms), and buyers approve to generate purchase orders. Core entities include accounts, catalogs, price lists, RFQs, quotes, purchase orders, shipments, invoices, and credit memos. PO workflows include statuses (draft/submitted/confirmed/backordered/partially_shipped/complete/canceled) and support split shipments, ASN records, and receiving (damages, short counts, lot numbers). Payment terms (Net 30), credit limits, and holds are enforceable rules. Buyers can file claims, request returns (RMA), and track credit issuance. Admins manage product categories, freight tables, and approval thresholds. All data—stock, tiered pricing, lead times, backorders, and shipment events—can be synthesized while still producing realistic operational scenarios.

name: RefurbCart Electronics Outlet
description: RefurbCart is a direct-to-consumer retail platform for refurbished electronics with graded condition and warranty management. Merchants manage SKUs with condition grades (A/B/C), serial-numbered inventory, accessories included, and warranty terms. Customers browse, compare, and purchase items; they can register products post-purchase to activate warranties. Key entities include products, grade variants, inventory units (serial, test result flags), carts, orders, payments, shipping labels, and warranty registrations. Order workflows include fraud review (pending/released), fulfillment (picked/packed/shipped/delivered), and post-sale service (returns, exchanges, repairs). Returns are handled via RMA records with reason codes, inspection outcomes, restocking fees, and disposition (restock/refurbish/parts/recycle). Repair tickets track diagnostics, parts used, labor, and status (received/in_repair/awaiting_parts/shipped_back/closed). The platform also supports coupons, bundles, and accessory add-ons; inventory reservation can be modeled with timeouts. Admins configure warranty policies, SLA targets, and refurbishment checklists. This scenario is highly suitable for API simulation because serial-level inventory, RMAs, repair workflows, and warranty state transitions are structured and synthesizable.

name: PantryPledge Food Bank Network
description: PantryPledge is a non-profit platform for food banks to manage donations, inventory, and distribution to partner pantries. Donors CRUD profiles, recurring donation pledges, and donation receipts; corporate donors can schedule bulk drop-offs with pallet counts and item manifests. Food bank staff manage warehouses, storage zones, inventory items (UPC/category, unit type, expiration date, lot), and inbound donations (source, inspection results, allergen flags). Distribution workflows include partner organizations, eligibility rules, and outbound orders (requested/approved/picked/ready/collected). Appointments for pickup/delivery are scheduled with time slots and capacity limits. The system tracks cold-chain requirements and expiration-based FEFO picking. Volunteer shifts can be linked to tasks (sort, pack, deliver) and required certifications. Key entities include donors, partners, households (anonymized), inventory lots, inbound/outbound transactions, appointments, volunteers, and compliance reports. Admins run reports on pounds distributed, waste, and donor impact statements with templated fields. All data—donation events, inventory lots, expiration dates, partner requests, and volunteer rosters—can be synthesized to test CRUD-heavy workflows without needing content or external feeds.

name: HandsOn Volunteer Scheduler
description: HandsOn is a volunteer management and scheduling platform for charities running recurring programs (tutoring, meal service, park cleanup). Organizations CRUD programs, events, shift slots (capacity, skills required, age requirements), locations, and waiver templates. Volunteers CRUD profiles, skills, availability preferences, emergency contacts, and certifications; they sign up for shifts, join waitlists, and log hours. Core entities include orgs, users, roles, events, shifts, registrations, attendance records, and communications. Workflows cover approval-based onboarding (applied/background_check/approved), shift lifecycle (open/full/closed/canceled), and attendance (checked_in/no_show/completed). Coordinators can message shift groups, assign team leads, and manage substitution requests. Hours can be validated by supervisors and exported for grants reporting. The platform supports recurring schedules, automatic reminders, and cancellation policies with strike counts. Admins manage multi-org networks, shared volunteer pools, and permissions across chapters. Data is fully synthesizable: events, rosters, capacities, skills matrices, attendance outcomes, and hour totals enable realistic API tests for scheduling conflicts, waitlist promotions, and compliance tracking.

name: BrightFund Campaign Builder
description: BrightFund is a fundraising platform for nonprofits running multi-channel campaigns (one-time, recurring, peer-to-peer, and event-based). Nonprofits CRUD campaigns (goal, start/end dates, match rules), donation forms (custom fields, suggested amounts), donor segments, and acknowledgment templates. Donors can give, manage recurring subscriptions, update payment methods, and download tax receipts. Peer fundraisers create personal pages, set sub-goals, and track contributions attributed to them. Core entities include nonprofits, campaigns, fundraising pages, donors, donations, recurring plans, payouts, and receipting records. Donation workflows include statuses (initiated/authorized/captured/failed/refunded) and chargeback/dispute handling. Matching gifts are modeled with employer records and verification statuses. The system supports ticketed fundraising events as an add-on: attendees, ticket types, check-in scans (token metadata), and add-on donations at checkout. Admin reporting includes cohort retention, channel attribution, and payout reconciliation (fees, net, schedule). Everything is structured and synthesizable—donation amounts, timestamps, donor profiles, campaign performance, and payout batches—making it ideal for database-driven API simulations.

name: HomeSense Smart Hub
description: HomeSense Smart Hub is a home automation platform that manages smart devices across households (thermostats, plugs, locks, leak sensors). Users CRUD homes, rooms, devices (model, firmware, capabilities), and access roles (owner/admin/guest). Device state is stored as time-stamped telemetry (temperature, humidity, power draw, battery) and command logs (lock/unlock, setpoint changes). Automation workflows center on rules and scenes: users create triggers (time schedules, sensor thresholds, geofence enter/exit) and actions (turn on device, adjust thermostat, send notification). Key entities include devices, sensor readings, automations, scenes, schedules, alerts, and maintenance records. Alerting supports severity, acknowledgment, and escalation contacts. Device onboarding includes pairing tokens, QR metadata, and status transitions (unpaired/pairing/online/offline). Firmware updates are modeled as jobs (scheduled/downloading/installing/success/failed) with rollback flags. Admin tools include device catalog management, feature flags, and rate limits. This scenario is excellent for synthesis because telemetry streams, command histories, schedules, and online/offline states can be generated deterministically while enabling rich CRUD and workflow testing.

name: FleetCharge EV Device Manager
description: FleetCharge is a device management portal for operating a network of EV charging stations for workplaces or municipalities. Operators CRUD sites, chargers, connectors, тариф plans (per kWh, per minute, idle fees), and access policies (RFID cards, guest passes). Each charger reports heartbeat status and meter readings; sessions are created when a vehicle plugs in. Key entities include sites, chargers, connectors, firmware versions, users/drivers, RFID tokens, charging sessions, tariffs, invoices, and maintenance tickets. Session workflows include states (starting/active/paused/ended/failed) with reasons and energy delivered. Billing supports monthly invoicing for fleets and ad-hoc payments for guests; operators can issue refunds and apply credits. Maintenance workflows include fault codes, remote resets, dispatch scheduling, parts used, and resolution times. Availability and reservations can be modeled per connector with time slots. Admins configure roaming partners (as external accounts), API keys, and data retention. All operational data—meter values, sessions, faults, firmware jobs, and invoices—can be synthesized to simulate realistic station operations without real hardware.

name: ToolShare Neighborhood Library
description: ToolShare is a community rental/borrowing platform for a neighborhood tool library (power tools, ladders, gardening equipment) operated by a nonprofit or co-op. Members CRUD profiles, membership plans, deposit balances, and borrowing history. Staff CRUD tool inventory with barcodes, categories, condition grades, replacement costs, and maintenance schedules. Borrowing workflows include reservations (requested/confirmed/expired), check-out/check-in transactions, due dates, extensions, and late fees. Tools can be bundled into kits (e.g., “tile kit”) with component tracking. Condition reports are captured at checkout and return using structured checklists and photo metadata; damage incidents generate invoices or deposit deductions and can trigger tool quarantine status. The platform supports member holds, waitlists, and borrowing limits based on membership tier. Volunteer shifts can be linked to operational tasks (inventory audit, sharpening, repairs). Admins manage policies (loan periods, fees), location hours, and notifications (due reminders, overdue escalation). Because the system is driven by structured inventory, reservations, transactions, and fee rules, it is highly suitable for API/database simulation with fully synthesizable data and deterministic state transitions.

name: Salesforce Field Service
description: Salesforce Field Service is a work-order and dispatching system for sending technicians to jobs. Users CRUD service accounts/sites, assets (serial number, install date), service contracts, work types, work orders, and service appointments (scheduled window, duration, priority). Dispatchers manage territories, operating hours, technician profiles, skills, certifications, and time-off. Scheduling workflows include creating a work order from a case, generating appointments, auto-assigning based on skills/availability, and manually dragging appointments between technicians with conflict checks. Appointment lifecycle can be modeled as statuses (unassigned → scheduled → en_route → on_site → completed/canceled) with timestamped check-ins. Inventory can be tracked via technician truck stock, parts consumption, transfers, and reorder thresholds. Mobile flows include offline-capable job notes, photos/attachment metadata, customer signatures, and expense capture. APIs can simulate route/ETA fields deterministically, SLA clocks, and exception handling (parts unavailable, customer not home). Reporting queries cover first-time-fix rate, technician utilization, backlog aging, and parts usage by asset model, all driven by structured records rather than unstructured content.

name: ServiceNow Facilities (Workplace Service Delivery)
description: ServiceNow Facilities is a workplace operations suite for handling facility requests, maintenance, and space management. Users CRUD locations (sites, buildings, floors, rooms), space attributes (capacity, amenities), assets (HVAC units, elevators), vendors, and maintenance schedules. Employees submit facility cases or work requests (category, urgency, description, preferred time), which route to queues based on location and service type. Requests become work orders and tasks with lifecycle states (new → assigned → in_progress → on_hold → completed → closed) and SLA timers. Technicians log labor entries, parts used, inspection checklists, and completion codes; supervisors approve and trigger billing or vendor dispatch. Preventive maintenance can generate recurring work orders from templates with calendar rules. Space management workflows include assigning departments to rooms, tracking occupancy, and managing moves/adds/changes (MAC) with approvals. The system supports approvals (manager, facilities lead), escalations, and notifications. API simulations can include deterministic assignment rules, SLA breaches, and asset downtime calculations. Reporting endpoints can query open requests by building, mean time to repair, vendor performance, and space utilization, all based on structured entities and timestamps.

name: ClassPass
description: ClassPass is a fitness class booking platform that manages studios, schedules, and credit-based reservations. Users CRUD member accounts, payment methods (token metadata), credit plans, and preferences. Studios CRUD locations, instructors, class types, class sessions (start time, capacity, credit cost), and attendance policies (late cancel windows, no-show fees). Booking workflows include searching sessions by location/time, reserving a spot (holding capacity), waitlisting, and transitioning statuses (booked → attended/late_canceled/no_show/canceled). The platform can simulate credit deductions, refunds, and penalty charges based on cancellation rules. Check-in can be modeled via QR codes or manual verification that updates attendance records and triggers payouts to studios. Members can manage favorites, recurring bookings, and account holds; studios can manage substitute instructors and session edits with re-notification to booked members. Admin APIs can run settlement cycles that aggregate attendance into payout batches (period, studio, fees, net). Analytics endpoints can query utilization rates, class popularity by type, churn-risk indicators using structured metrics, and dispute workflows (member appeals, studio adjustments) entirely from synthesized events.

name: UtilityCloud (Municipal Water Billing + Meter Ops)
description: UtilityCloud is a municipal utility management system for water service accounts, meter readings, and billing. Staff CRUD customers, service addresses, service agreements, meters (serial, size, install date), rate plans (tiers, fixed charges), and billing cycles. Operational workflows include scheduling meter reads by route, capturing readings (manual entry or device import), validating anomalies (spikes, rollovers), and generating bills with line items (usage, fees, taxes). Payment workflows include posting payments (cash/check/card metadata), allocating across charges, handling partial payments, and issuing adjustments/credits. Delinquency can be modeled with dunning stages (past_due → notice_sent → shutoff_scheduled → disconnected) plus reconnection work orders. Work orders cover meter swaps, leak investigations, and service turn-ons/turn-offs with technician assignment and completion timestamps. Customer service cases track disputes, payment plans, and move-in/move-out requests with prorations. APIs can provide statements, aging reports, and consumption history by month; all data (reads, usage, rates, invoices) is numeric and synthesizable, enabling realistic simulations without external real-time feeds.

name: GiveBridge Donor CRM
description: GiveBridge Donor CRM is a nonprofit fundraising and donor-management platform for tracking constituents and gifts across campaigns. Staff CRUD donor profiles (households, contacts, communication preferences, addresses), relationships (spouse/employer), and engagement records (calls, emails, meeting notes). Fundraisers CRUD campaigns, appeals, and donation forms with suggested amounts, designations (restricted funds), and matching-gift rules. Donations are recorded as transactions (one-time/recurring, method, fees, soft credits), with automated receipting and tax letter generation (templates + merge fields). Workflows include pledge management (pledge schedules, installments, reminders), major-gift pipelines (stages, tasks, expected amount), and event fundraising (tables, ticket types, check-in). Admins manage users/roles, integrations (payment processor tokens), and data imports as batch jobs with validation and deduplication. Reporting endpoints return rollups by campaign, fund, date range, and donor segment, enabling realistic synthesized datasets for testing receipts, recurring gift lifecycles, refunds, and accounting exports.

name: CrowdCause Peer-to-Peer Fundraising
description: CrowdCause is a peer-to-peer fundraising platform where organizations run public campaigns and supporters create personal fundraising pages. Orgs CRUD campaigns (goal, start/end, matching windows), teams, and page templates. Supporters CRUD profiles, fundraising pages (story blurb, goal, cover image URL metadata), and social sharing links (tracked UTM codes). Donations are CRUD transactions tied to a campaign/page/team, with options for dedication, comments (short text), anonymity, and employer match info. Workflows include donation status transitions (created → authorized → captured → receipted → refunded/failed), chargeback cases, and pledge-to-donate commitments. Team captains manage members, invite links, and progress dashboards; admins manage moderation queues for page content flags (approved/rejected) without needing long-form content generation. The API supports leaderboards, milestone badges (rules-based), scheduled emails (template + audience filters), and campaign closure (freeze pages, finalize totals, export receipts). All entities and metrics are synthesizable for end-to-end simulations.

name: VolunteerShift Scheduler
description: VolunteerShift is a volunteer management system for nonprofits coordinating shifts, skills, and compliance. Coordinators CRUD volunteer profiles (skills, interests, availability windows, emergency contacts), background-check records (provider, status, expiry), and required trainings (modules, completion dates). Programs are modeled as projects with locations, roles, and shift templates; staff CRUD shifts (start/end, capacity, check-in rules) and assign volunteers manually or via sign-up. Workflows include application review (applied → screened → approved/declined), waitlists, swap/cover requests, and attendance tracking (scheduled/checked_in/no_show). Time is captured as timesheets and can be approved by supervisors; hours roll up by program, grant, and volunteer. Messaging is structured as notifications (email/SMS placeholders), with opt-in preferences and audit logs. The platform supports document metadata (waivers, IDs) and expiration alerts. Admin endpoints manage organizations, sites, permission roles, and import jobs. The data model is highly CRUD-friendly and enables realistic simulation of scheduling constraints, capacity, and compliance expirations.

name: GrantPulse Program & Grants Manager
description: GrantPulse is a nonprofit grants and program-delivery platform focused on application workflows and award tracking. Staff CRUD grant programs (eligibility rules, required fields, scoring rubrics), application forms (sections, questions, validations), and reviewer pools. Applicants CRUD organization profiles, contacts, budgets (line items), and applications with attachments metadata. Workflows include submission states (draft → submitted → under_review → revisions_requested → approved/declined), reviewer assignments, scorecards, conflict-of-interest flags, and committee decisions. Award management covers grant agreements (versioned docs metadata), payment schedules (milestones, deliverables, due dates), and disbursement transactions with statuses (scheduled/processing/paid/failed). Grantees submit reports (structured metrics, outcomes, expenses) and can request budget amendments or no-cost extensions. The API supports tasks, reminders, audit logs, and exports for accounting. Synthetic data can model realistic cycles: multi-round review, partial payments, compliance holds, and performance reporting without requiring content-heavy narratives.

name: CareLink Patient Portal
description: CareLink is a patient portal for clinics and hospital systems supporting appointments, records access, and secure messaging. Patients CRUD demographics, insurance policies, pharmacies, and consent preferences; they can request appointments, reschedule, cancel, and join waitlists. Clinicians CRUD appointments, encounter summaries, problem lists, allergies, immunizations, and care plans as structured records. Lab results and vitals are modeled as discrete observations with reference ranges, flags, and timestamps, enabling realistic synthesized history. Messaging is implemented as threads with participants, message events, attachments metadata, and triage status (new/routed/answered/closed). Billing features include statements, balances, payment plans, and payment transactions (authorized/captured/refunded). Workflows cover intake forms (pre-visit questionnaires), document delivery (release of information requests), and notification preferences. Admin APIs manage providers, departments, appointment types, and scheduling rules (duration, buffers). The system emphasizes CRUD operations and lifecycle states across appointments, clinical documentation, and patient communications.

name: RxHarbor Pharmacy Fulfillment
description: RxHarbor is a pharmacy management and fulfillment system for prescription intake, adjudication, and shipment. Staff CRUD patient profiles, prescribers, medications (NDC, form, strength), insurance plans, and prior authorizations. Prescriptions are modeled as orders with lifecycle statuses (received → data_entry → verification → insurance_adjudication → fill → pharmacist_check → ready → shipped/picked_up → completed/returned). Inventory is tracked by lots (quantity on hand, expiry, location), with adjustments, cycle counts, and recall flags. The platform supports refills (eligible dates, remaining refills), substitution rules (generic allowed), and counseling notes. Shipping includes labels, carrier tracking numbers, and delivery events; cold-chain can be simulated via packaging type and temperature log placeholders. Billing entities include copays, claim responses, reversals, and refunds. Admin APIs manage store locations, user roles (tech/pharmacist), workflow rules, and integrations (eRx inbox tokens). This scenario enables robust CRUD testing across orders, inventory, and compliance-driven state transitions.

name: PawPartner Veterinary Practice
description: PawPartner is a veterinary clinic practice-management platform covering scheduling, medical records, and invoicing for pets. Clinics CRUD clients (owners), pets (species, breed, weight history, microchip), vaccinations, allergies, and problem lists. Appointments include reason codes, assigned veterinarian/tech, room, and status (requested/confirmed/checked_in/in_exam/completed/canceled). Encounters store structured notes, diagnostics (lab panels with values), procedures, and treatment plans. The platform supports estimates (line items, ranges), invoices, payments, and refunds; inventory tracks meds and supplies by SKU with reorder thresholds. Pharmacy features include prescriptions, dosing instructions, refill rules, and dispensing logs. Workflows include reminders (vaccinations due, annual exams), hospitalization stays (cage assignments, daily rounds entries), and client communications via message threads. Admin endpoints manage clinic locations, pricing catalogs, provider schedules, and templates for common visit types. All data—clients, pets, visits, lab values, and charges—can be synthesized realistically for API simulations.

name: ShelterTrack Rescue Intake & Adoption
description: ShelterTrack is an animal rescue and shelter operations platform managing intakes, foster placements, and adoptions. Staff CRUD animals (intake date, condition, behavior notes, photos metadata), medical records (vaccines, treatments, surgeries), and microchip registrations. Intakes are modeled as cases with source (stray/owner surrender/transfer) and required forms metadata; animals move through statuses (intake → quarantine → available → fostered → pending_adoption → adopted/returned). Foster homes are managed as profiles with capacity, pet preferences, and home-check status; placements track start/end dates and supplies issued. Adoption workflows include applicant profiles, applications, screenings, meet-and-greet appointments, fees, contracts metadata, and post-adoption follow-ups. Inventory can cover donated supplies (food, crates, meds) with stock movements and distribution to fosters. The platform supports volunteer assignments for events (adoption fairs) and donation intake tied to specific animals or medical funds. Admin endpoints manage locations, user roles, form templates, and reporting dashboards (LOS, adoption rates, medical costs). All entities are structured and easily synthesized.

name: TeleVisit Triage & Virtual Clinic
description: TeleVisit is a telehealth platform focused on triage, scheduling, and visit documentation rather than live video. Patients create symptom check-ins (structured questionnaires), upload photo metadata (e.g., rash image reference), select preferred time windows, and CRUD payment/insurance info. Clinicians and coordinators manage provider availability, queue rules, and visit records. Encounters are objects with timestamps, participants, chief complaint, vitals (synthetic), assessment codes, prescriptions, and follow-up tasks. Workflows include triage routing (new → needs_info → queued → assigned), consent capture, asynchronous “message visit” threads, and appointment conversion to scheduled tele-visit with status transitions (scheduled → in_session → completed → note_signed). The platform tracks clinical documentation via templates and structured fields, supports referral creation (specialty, urgency, receiving clinic), and generates patient instructions from controlled text blocks. Admin APIs support license/credential records, state coverage rules, and billing artifacts (CPT-like codes, superbills, claim status: draft/submitted/paid/denied). Everything is synthesizable: symptom forms, provider calendars, encounter outcomes, and deterministic SLA timers for queue performance testing.

name: RxReady Pharmacy Fulfillment
description: RxReady is a pharmacy operations and patient-facing refill platform for chain or independent pharmacies. Patients CRUD family profiles, medication lists (drug name, strength, directions), refill requests, delivery addresses, and pickup preferences. Pharmacists and technicians manage prescription records (Rx number, prescriber, refills remaining), inventory lots (NDC-like codes, quantity on hand, expiry date), and fulfillment work queues. Refill workflows model statuses (requested → verification → insurance_review → fill_in_progress → ready → picked_up/delivered → canceled) with reasons and timestamps. The system supports prior authorization tasks, substitution logs (generic vs brand), and counseling notes. Pricing can be simulated with copay estimates, discount cards, and cash price overrides. Delivery is modeled with shipments (carrier, tracking token, delivery window) and proof-of-delivery metadata. APIs include drug catalog endpoints, patient notifications, label print jobs, and controlled substance flags that trigger additional verification steps. Data is highly synthesizable: medication catalogs, refill cycles, lot expirations, and queue volume patterns—ideal for load tests, role-based access checks, and audit trail validation.

name: PawClinic Veterinary Practice Manager
description: PawClinic is a veterinary clinic management system that handles appointments, patient records, and billing for companion animals. Clients CRUD owner profiles, pets (species, breed, age, weight history), vaccination records, and appointment requests. Clinic staff CRUD providers, rooms, appointment slots, services (exam, surgery, grooming), and medical records (SOAP notes, diagnoses, medications, lab orders). Workflows include appointment lifecycle (requested → confirmed → checked_in → in_exam → completed), consent forms for procedures, and discharge instructions generated from standardized templates. Inventory covers vaccines and medications as stock items with lots and expirations, plus dispensing records linked to visits. Billing models estimates, invoices, line items, discounts, and payment records with statuses (unpaid/partial/paid/refunded). The platform supports reminders for vaccines and preventatives, follow-up tasks, and boarding stays with daily care checklists. APIs can simulate lab results as structured panels, growth/weight time series, and deterministic reminder schedules. This is database-driven end-to-end: clients, pets, visits, medications, inventory, invoices, and communications—without relying on content-heavy features.

name: SprintBoard Clinical Projects
description: SprintBoard Clinical Projects is a task and project management tool tailored for healthcare operations teams (quality improvement, clinic launches, compliance). Users CRUD workspaces, projects, boards, tasks, subtasks, and dependencies. Tasks support assignees, due dates, priority, checklists, labels, and attachments metadata. Healthcare-specific entities include standard operating procedure (SOP) records, policy acknowledgements, and audit items linked to tasks. Workflows include configurable statuses (backlog → in_progress → blocked → ready_for_review → done), approval steps for policy changes, and recurring tasks for monthly audits. Templates can generate project plans for common initiatives (new site onboarding, vaccine clinic setup) with relative deadlines. The system supports role-based permissions, watchlists, comments, and activity logs for traceability. Automations are rule-driven (e.g., “when status becomes blocked, notify compliance lead”; “when due date is within 3 days, escalate”). Reporting includes burndown-like metrics and SLA timers for operational requests. Everything is synthesizable: tasks, users, schedules, and rules—ideal for API CRUD, search/filter endpoints over structured fields, and event-driven triggers without any content-heavy dependencies.

name: CollabRounds Care Team Handoffs
description: CollabRounds is a collaboration platform for inpatient or clinic care teams centered on handoffs, assignments, and structured daily plans. Teams CRUD units/wards, patient lists (MRN-like identifiers), care team memberships, and roles (attending, resident, nurse, case manager). Each patient has structured cards for problems, goals, orders to review, discharge barriers, and tasks. Handoff notes use controlled templates with short text sections and required fields; revisions create version histories. Rounds workflows include daily checklist completion, task delegation with due times, and escalation rules for overdue items. Communication is modeled as patient-linked threads with mentions, read receipts, and triage states. The platform also tracks consult requests (service, priority, requested time, status) and discharge planning items (transport, DME, follow-up appointment). APIs can generate deterministic daily census changes, admission/discharge events, and task loads to stress-test permissions and audit trails. It avoids AI or long-form content while still providing realistic, high-value interactions: list management, assignment routing, state transitions, and consistent event timelines for handoff reliability metrics.

name: FlowLink No-Code Workflow Automations
description: FlowLink is a workflow automation platform (Zapier-like) designed for clinics, pharmacies, and pet service businesses to connect internal tools via triggers and actions. Users CRUD connections (API keys as tokens), workflows, steps, filters, and mapping rules. Supported app modules are simulated: appointments, invoices, inventory, tickets, and messaging. Triggers include events like “appointment created,” “prescription ready,” “booking canceled,” or “inventory below threshold.” Actions include “create task,” “send notification,” “update record,” “create invoice,” and “add tag.” Each workflow run produces an execution log with step status (queued/running/succeeded/failed), input/output payload snapshots, retries, and error codes. The platform supports schedules, rate limits, and conditional branches with bounded rule expressions. Admin controls include environment variables, secrets vault metadata, and role-based access. Data is fully synthesizable: fake events, deterministic payloads, and controlled failure injection (timeouts, 429s, validation errors) for robust API testing. It’s highly database-driven, emphasizing CRUD plus orchestration across entities and providing realistic auditability for regulated environments.

name: TherapyTrack Remote Monitoring
description: TherapyTrack is a remote patient monitoring and home-therapy adherence platform used by PT/OT clinics and chronic-care programs. Patients CRUD profiles, assigned programs, daily check-ins, and device pairings (device metadata only). Clinicians manage patient cohorts, care plans, exercise libraries (name, reps, sets, contraindications), and thresholds (pain score limits, step goals). The system records time-series observations: pain scores, range-of-motion values, blood pressure fields, or session completion, all synthesizable. Alerts are rule-based (missed check-ins, out-of-range readings) and generate tasks and message threads. Workflows include program enrollment (invited → active → paused → completed), adherence scoring, clinician review queues, and periodic reassessments that produce structured outcomes. Scheduling supports follow-up appointments and automated reminders. Data sharing is handled via consent records and export jobs (CSV/FHIR-like JSON bundles) with job statuses and downloadable artifact metadata. APIs can simulate device reading ingestion, backfilled data, and deterministic alert generation. This provides rich CRUD interactions across patients, plans, readings, alerts, and tasks—ideal for integration testing without requiring real devices or clinical content generation.

name: BuildGrid Permits (Construction Permitting + Inspections)
description: BuildGrid Permits is a municipal-style permitting and inspection portal used by contractors and property owners to submit, track, and close out construction permits. Users CRUD applicants (companies, license numbers, contacts), properties (address, parcel id, zoning), permit applications (project type, valuation, scope, plan set metadata), and supporting documents (file metadata, revision numbers). Workflow centers on statuses such as draft → submitted → intake_review → plan_review → fees_due → issued → inspection_phase → finaled/closed, with role-based actions for applicants, reviewers, and inspectors. Reviewers can create review cycles, add checklists, request corrections, and record approvals/denials with reasons. Fee schedules and invoices are structured objects (line items, payments, refunds). Inspections are scheduled entities (type, time window, inspector assignment), with outcomes (pass/fail/partial), notes, code references, and required re-inspections. The system can generate synthetic calendars, random but consistent review timelines, and compliance metrics. APIs support notifications (email/SMS templates), audit logs, and reporting on permit volume, turnaround time, and inspector utilization.

name: LabLink LIMS (Sample Tracking + Test Results)
description: LabLink LIMS is a laboratory information management system for environmental, food, or clinical-style testing without needing real analyzers. Users CRUD clients, projects, sampling locations, and sample orders (chain-of-custody, collection timestamps, container types, preservation). Each sample contains tests/panels with analytes, method codes, detection limits, and expected turnaround times. Workflow models sample lifecycle: created → received → accessioned → in_preparation → in_analysis → qc_review → reported, including holds, re-runs, and cancellations. Technicians record results as structured values (numeric, qualitative, units), attach instrument run metadata, and enter QC artifacts (blanks, spikes, duplicates) with pass/fail rules. Supervisors can approve batches, issue amended reports with versioning, and manage nonconformance tickets. Inventory modules CRUD reagents, lot numbers, expirations, and consumption events. Billing can be simulated via price lists and invoices per test. APIs support barcode labels, sample log scanning events, and deterministic generation of realistic result distributions and QC exception rates.

name: FleetPulse ELD (Fleet Compliance + Vehicle Maintenance)
description: FleetPulse ELD is a fleet management and compliance platform for vehicles and drivers. Users CRUD drivers (license, endorsements), vehicles (VIN, odometer, fuel type), trailers, and dispatch routes (origin/destination, stops, planned miles). Core workflows simulate ELD-style duty logs with statuses (off_duty/sleeper/on_duty/driving) and automatic event creation from synthetic GPS pings. Dispatchers create loads, assign drivers/vehicles, track delivery milestones, and record proof-of-delivery metadata. Maintenance modules CRUD service schedules, work orders, parts used, vendor invoices, and inspection checklists (pre-trip/post-trip). Compliance features model DVIR defects, corrective actions, and audit trails; violations (HOS, speeding) are generated from rules. Fuel and toll transactions are structured events tied to trips and cost centers. APIs enable querying trips, generating daily logs, reconciling odometer vs route miles, and producing compliance reports for a date range. Data is fully synthesizable (locations, times, costs), while still supporting realistic edge cases like missed check-ins, vehicle swaps, and roadside inspections.

name: GymPilot Studio (Classes + Memberships + Check-ins)
description: GymPilot Studio is a membership and class scheduling app for fitness studios (yoga, cycling, HIIT). Users CRUD members, membership plans (billing interval, class credits, freeze rules), waivers, and payment profiles (token metadata only). Staff CRUD instructors, rooms, and recurring class templates (capacity, equipment needs, level). Scheduling workflows create class sessions, open booking windows, manage waitlists, and enforce cancellation policies with fees and refund rules. Members book/cancel/reschedule, purchase add-ons (towels, rentals), and check in via QR code events. Attendance is tracked per session with statuses (booked/checked_in/no_show/cancelled_late). The platform supports promos and referral codes, store credit, and membership lifecycle (trial → active → past_due → cancelled) with dunning-style reminder schedules. Reporting APIs provide utilization, revenue by plan, instructor payroll calculations (per-class rates/bonuses), and churn. All data—times, rosters, payments, and check-ins—can be synthesized while keeping constraints realistic (capacity limits, overlapping schedules, and membership entitlements).

name: VendorGate SRM (Supplier Onboarding + Scorecards)
description: VendorGate SRM is a supplier relationship management tool for procurement teams. Users CRUD suppliers, sites/addresses, contacts, bank details (masked metadata), and product/service catalogs (SKUs, lead times, MOQs). Onboarding workflows collect structured questionnaires, tax forms metadata, and compliance attestations, moving through statuses: invited → in_review → approved/blocked. Teams manage contracts as structured records (start/end dates, renewal options, pricing tiers, SLAs) and link them to supplier sites and categories. Purchase requests and POs can be modeled with line items, approvals, and receiving events. Performance management includes scorecards with metrics (on-time delivery %, defect rate, responsiveness), periodic evaluations, corrective action plans, and risk ratings. Incident workflows track nonconformances and supplier CAPAs with tasks, due dates, and evidence attachments metadata. APIs support vendor search by category, renewal reminders, approval routing, and consolidated reporting on spend, risk, and performance trends. All entities are short-text/number driven and easy to synthesize with consistent relationships across suppliers, contracts, and purchase activity.

name: ClinicQueue (Appointments + Intake Forms + Referrals)
description: ClinicQueue is an appointment and intake management system for outpatient clinics (dental, physio, optometry). Users CRUD patients, dependents, insurance plans (policy metadata), providers, and clinic locations/rooms. Scheduling supports appointment types (duration, prep requirements), availability templates, and booking workflows with confirmations, reminders, and cancellation/no-show tracking. Intake is modeled as structured forms (questions, answer types, required flags) and submissions tied to appointments, plus consent documents (versioned templates, signature metadata). Referrals are first-class entities: referral source, reason codes, priority, and lifecycle (received → scheduled → in_treatment → discharged), with attached documents metadata. Staff can create clinical notes as structured fields (diagnosis codes, procedure codes, vitals, outcome measures) rather than long narrative. Billing can be simulated via claims objects (codes, amounts, status: submitted/accepted/denied/paid) and patient balances with payment plans. APIs cover patient lookup, slot search, booking, reminders, and reporting on wait times, provider utilization, and referral conversion rates—fully synthesizable without real medical content.

name: PolicyForge Broker Portal (Insurance Quotes + Renewals)
description: PolicyForge is a broker portal for quoting, binding, and servicing small commercial policies (general liability, property, auto). Users CRUD agencies, producers, customers, and insured entities (business info, locations, vehicles, payroll/revenue figures). Quoting workflows create submissions, rate them using deterministic rules, and generate quote options (limits, deductibles, endorsements) with premium breakdowns and taxes/fees. Submissions move through statuses: draft → under_review → quoted → bound → issued, with declinations and referral reasons. Endorsements and midterm changes are modeled as change requests (effective date, change type) that produce revised documents metadata and premium deltas. Renewal workflows clone expiring policies, apply exposure changes, and track offers accepted/declined. Claims can be included as structured FNOL records (loss date, cause, reserve amounts, status updates) without requiring narrative. Users manage documents (certificates of insurance, binders) as templates with populated fields and versioning. APIs support quote retrieval, bind actions, payment schedules, commission statements, and compliance checks (required fields, audit logs). All data is numeric/structured and ideal for synthesis.

name: SchoolOps SIS Lite (Enrollment + Attendance + Grades)
description: SchoolOps SIS Lite is a student information system focused on operational records rather than content delivery. Admins CRUD schools, academic terms, courses, sections, room schedules, and staff assignments. Student workflows include applications, enrollment, guardians/contacts, emergency info, and program participation (IEP/504 flags as structured indicators only). Daily operations generate attendance entries (present/absent/tardy, reason codes), behavior incidents (type, severity, action taken), and gradebooks with assignments as structured items (category, points, due date) and scores. Scheduling includes timetables, conflicts, and roster changes (add/drop with effective dates). Communication is modeled as message logs and notification preferences, not long newsletters. Fees and payments can be simulated with student accounts (charges, payments, waivers) and meal plans. APIs enable roster exports, attendance summaries, transcript generation from course completions, and analytics on attendance trends, course capacity, and intervention tracking. Data is highly synthesizable: names, dates, scores, codes, and relationships across students, guardians, courses, and sections while supporting realistic constraints like prerequisites, maximum class sizes, and transfer histories.

name: ChargeBack Desk (Disputes + Evidence + Outcomes)
description: ChargeBack Desk is a dispute management platform for merchants handling card chargebacks across multiple processors. Users CRUD merchant accounts, processor connections (token metadata), transactions (amount, card metadata, descriptor), and dispute cases. Each case tracks reason codes, deadlines, representment eligibility, and lifecycle statuses: opened → evidence_gathering → submitted → under_review → won/lost/expired. Evidence packets are structured collections of documents metadata (receipt, shipping proof, customer comms), typed fields (AVS/CVV results, delivery timestamps), and generated summaries. Workflows include task assignments, SLA timers, and escalation rules for high-value cases. The system models partial reversals, pre-arbitration, and fee events, posting ledger entries to a dispute accounting table. Users can create templates for evidence checklists by dispute type and automate retrieval of transaction metadata. Reporting APIs provide win rate by reason code, aging queues, recovered amounts, and processor comparisons. All data can be synthesized deterministically: transaction streams, dispute creation rates, deadlines, and outcomes, enabling realistic testing of queue management, compliance, and financial reconciliation without needing real payment rails.

name: Subscribely Console (Subscription Billing + Entitlements)
description: Subscribely Console is a subscription management platform for SaaS products, focusing on billing state and entitlements rather than payments processing. Users CRUD customers, organizations, users, plans, add-ons, and coupons. Subscriptions include start dates, billing cycles, proration rules, trial periods, and status transitions (trialing → active → past_due → paused → cancelled). Invoices are generated as structured objects (line items, taxes, discounts), with payment attempts modeled as events (succeeded/failed, failure codes) and dunning schedules controlling reminders and retries. Entitlements map plans to feature flags and usage limits; usage records are posted via API (metered events) and drive overage charges. Account changes (upgrade/downgrade, seat changes) create amendments with effective dates and audit trails. The platform supports multi-currency price books, tax regions, and revenue recognition schedules as simplified rules (monthly allocation). APIs cover checkout session creation (tokenized), subscription lifecycle actions, usage ingestion, and reporting on MRR, churn, cohort retention, and invoice aging. All data—customers, invoices, usage, and entitlements—is easily synthesized while preserving realistic constraints and edge cases.

name: ServiceNow CMDB Lite
description: ServiceNow CMDB Lite is a configuration and operations management portal centered on tracking enterprise assets and their relationships. Users CRUD configuration items (CIs) such as servers, laptops, network devices, applications, databases, and cloud resources, with attributes (owner, environment, lifecycle state, cost center, location). Relationship records capture depends_on/hosted_on/connected_to mappings and support impact analysis queries. Workflows include onboarding new assets via import jobs (CSV batch runs with validation errors), periodic discovery “syncs” (deterministic updates to last_seen, installed software lists, and compliance flags), and change governance (propose change → peer review → approved → implemented → verified). Access patterns include role-based visibility by business unit and environment, and audit trails for every CI update. Additional entities include maintenance windows, outage events, runbooks, and compliance attestations (pass/fail, evidence metadata). The platform supports dashboard-style APIs for counts by state, aging reports, and relationship graphs. This scenario is highly synth-friendly: identifiers, timestamps, statuses, and structured attributes can be generated while still exercising rich CRUD, batch, and workflow interactions.

name: CampusLMS Cloud (Higher-Ed Course Delivery + Gradebook)
description: CampusLMS Cloud is a learning management system for colleges and training programs. Instructors CRUD courses, sections, term schedules, modules, pages (short content blocks), files (metadata), and assignments (rubrics, due dates, allowed attempts). Enrollment is modeled via rosters (students, TAs, instructors) with roles and section-specific accommodations (extra time, alternate due dates). Students submit assignment attempts (timestamps, attachment metadata, status: submitted/late/resubmitted/graded) and receive grades, comments, and rubric scores. The gradebook supports weighted categories, drops/curves, late policies, and manual overrides with audit logs. Quizzes are structured item banks (question types, points, randomized sets) with attempt records and proctoring flags (metadata only). Messaging supports announcements and course inbox threads with read states. Admin workflows include course templates, cross-listing sections, SIS import jobs (batch run status, row-level errors), and analytics dashboards (activity counts, submission rates) derived from event logs—fully synthesizable without needing long-form content.

name: SkillPath Academy (Cohort Courses + Certificates)
description: SkillPath Academy is a cohort-based course platform for professional upskilling. Staff CRUD programs, cohorts (start/end dates, capacity), lessons (titles, short descriptions), and live events (sessions, instructors, attendance). Learners enroll into cohorts, track progress, and complete checkpoints (forms, quizzes, assignments) that generate completion records. Content is primarily structured: curriculum outlines, lesson metadata, and resource links; no need for long articles or media hosting beyond file metadata. Workflows include applications (submitted → reviewed → accepted/waitlisted/rejected), payments (installments, coupons), and scholarship approvals. Instructors manage office hours slots, announcements, and feedback on assignments using rubric-style fields. Certificates are generated as entities with criteria (required lessons, minimum score, attendance threshold) and issuance states (eligible → issued → revoked) with verification codes. The platform includes team-based projects: CRUD teams, team members, submissions, and peer evaluations. Admin tools cover cohort cloning, bulk enrollment imports, role permissions, and analytics derived from events (logins, lesson completions, assignment turnaround time).

name: ExamBank Pro (Question Bank + Secure Assessments)
description: ExamBank Pro helps schools and certification bodies build and deliver assessments from a structured item bank. Authors CRUD questions (type, stem, choices, correct answer, tags, difficulty, objectives) and group them into pools. Exams are assembled as blueprints with constraints (topic distribution, difficulty quotas, time limits) and generate forms/versions for delivery. Candidate management includes CRUD candidates, eligibility windows, accommodations, and attempts. Attempt records capture responses, per-item timing, and statuses (started/paused/submitted/invalidated) with integrity flags (IP/device metadata, proctor check results as boolean fields). Scoring supports auto-scored items, manual review queues, partial credit rules, and regrade workflows (appeal submitted → reviewer assigned → decision). Reporting is database-driven: item statistics (p-value, discrimination), cut score configurations, pass/fail results, and certificate issuance integration (verification codes). Operations include scheduling exam sessions at test centers (locations, seats, check-in events) and remote sessions (token-based access). Admins manage roles, audit logs, and export jobs (CSV/PDF metadata) for regulators—everything synthesizable via deterministic data generation.

name: MemberSphere (Subscription Membership + Access Entitlements)
description: MemberSphere runs subscription-based memberships for communities and professional associations. Organizations CRUD membership plans (price, billing cycle, trial, seat limits), perks/entitlements (content access flags, event discounts, support tiers), and member profiles. The billing model includes subscriptions, invoices, payments, proration events, refunds, and dunning workflows (past_due → retrying → suspended → canceled). Access control is driven by entitlements linked to plans and add-ons; members can upgrade/downgrade and manage payment methods. The platform supports member directories (profile fields, privacy settings), applications (submitted → approved/declined), and renewals with automated reminders. Groups/chapters are modeled as entities with admins, member lists, and activity feeds (short posts/updates). Loyalty-style engagement can be simulated via points (earn rules, redemptions) and badges. Admins manage coupons, bulk imports, tax settings, and reporting (MRR, churn, cohort retention). Integrations are modeled via API keys and webhooks for “subscription updated” and “invoice paid.” All entities are CRUD-friendly and realistic to synthesize.

name: RetailRewards Hub (Loyalty Program + Offers + Redemption)
description: RetailRewards Hub powers a multi-store loyalty program without needing live POS data. Operators CRUD merchants, store locations, members, membership tiers, earn/burn rules, and offers (coupons, multipliers, targeted segments). Member activity is modeled as transactions (amount, store, timestamp, channel) that generate points ledger entries (earned/adjusted/redeemed/expired) with balances computed from the ledger. Offers have lifecycles (draft → active → paused → expired) and redemption rules (min spend, usage limits, exclusions) plus redemption events (reserved → redeemed → reversed). Campaigns can target segments derived from member attributes and past activity (e.g., “inactive 30 days”), with message logs and delivery states. The platform supports referrals (codes, attribution windows), customer service adjustments (manual point grants, tier overrides) with audit trails, and fraud flags (suspicious redemption velocity). APIs can simulate barcode/QR tokens for membership lookup and coupon redemption. Reporting covers breakage, redemption rate, tier migration, and store performance using synthesized datasets.

name: CreatorPass Library (Digital Content Access + Licensing)
description: CreatorPass Library sells access to a catalog of digital assets where the core is metadata and entitlements, not hosting media. Publishers CRUD creators, catalogs, assets (title, type, tags, preview URL metadata), and license terms (personal/commercial, seat count, expiration). Customers CRUD accounts, teams, payment methods, and subscriptions or one-time purchases. Purchases create entitlements granting download/access rights; entitlements can be time-bound, revoked, or upgraded. Download events are tracked with rate limits and device fingerprints (metadata) to enable anti-abuse workflows. The system supports bundles, discount codes, and affiliate tracking (referrer ids, payouts). Asset updates are versioned (v1/v2) with changelogs and compatibility flags; customers can access prior versions depending on license. Compliance workflows include DMCA/takedown requests (submitted → reviewed → actioned) and license audits (seat overage detection). Admins manage taxonomy, featured collections, and reporting (ARPU, asset popularity, churn). Everything is synthesizable because it relies on structured asset metadata, not long-form content.

name: PolicyLearn Compliance (Training Assignments + Attestations)
description: PolicyLearn Compliance is a corporate compliance training and policy attestation system. Admins CRUD employees (or learner accounts), departments, roles, locations, and training modules represented by structured lessons/quizzes (titles, durations, question sets) plus policy documents stored as file metadata. Assignments are generated by rules (by role/location) or manually and tracked with statuses (assigned → in_progress → completed/overdue/waived). Learners complete modules and submit attestations (I agree/I acknowledge) with timestamps and IP/device metadata. The platform supports recurring campaigns (annual anti-harassment, quarterly security) with versioning so completions map to a specific policy version. Exceptions and escalations are modeled via cases (noncompliance, extension requests) routed to managers. Audit logs capture every change to assignments and completions for regulatory evidence. Reporting includes completion rates by department, overdue lists, and exportable evidence packets (records + metadata). Integrations can be simulated: HRIS user sync jobs, webhook events for completion, and SSO tokens. The system is highly suitable for CRUD-driven API simulation with deterministic workflows.

name: ClauseCraft Compliance Hub
description: ClauseCraft Compliance Hub is a governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) platform for small-to-mid organizations to run repeatable compliance programs (SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA-lite). Admins CRUD organizations, business units, frameworks, controls, policies, and evidence requests. Controls have owners, frequencies, test procedures, and mappings to requirements; evidence items store metadata (type, source, period, reviewer, link/file reference, collected_at) and move through statuses (requested/submitted/needs_changes/approved/expired). Workflows include scheduled control tasks, automated reminders, reviewer queues, and audit readiness dashboards generated from underlying records. Users manage risk registers (risk, likelihood, impact, mitigations, residual risk) and exception/waiver requests with approvals, expirations, and compensating controls. The system supports vendor risk: CRUD vendors, questionnaires (question bank, scoring), assessments, and findings with remediation plans. Integrations can be simulated via API jobs that “pull” evidence snapshots from configured sources (e.g., ticketing exports, access logs metadata) and attach them to controls. All activity is captured in an audit log (actor, action, entity, timestamp) suitable for deterministic test environments.

name: SignWave eSignature Rooms
description: SignWave eSignature Rooms is a document signing platform centered on structured envelopes and signer workflows rather than content. Users CRUD templates (fields, roles, routing order), documents (file metadata, hash, page count), and envelopes that bundle documents and recipients. Each envelope has recipients with roles (signer/approver/cc), authentication rules (email OTP, access code), and field assignments (signature, initials, date, checkbox, text input). Workflows include sequential or parallel signing, reminders, expiration, and voiding. Envelope status transitions (draft/sent/viewed/signed/completed/declined/voided/expired) drive webhooks and event logs. Users can manage teams, permissions, brand settings, and reusable clauses/field sets. For compliance, the platform stores a signing certificate record (envelope id, signer identity metadata, IP/device metadata, timestamps, document hashes) and tamper-evident audit trail events. APIs allow creating envelopes from templates, generating signing links, uploading documents, retrieving completion packets, and querying envelope history. Test data is easily synthesized: fake recipients, deterministic timestamps, status sequences, and document metadata without needing real document content.

name: RenewLoop Subscription Studio
description: RenewLoop Subscription Studio is a subscription and membership billing platform for SaaS, newsletters, gyms, and associations. Admins CRUD products, plans (price, interval, trial, setup fees), add-ons, coupons, and tax rules. Customers can be created via API with payment method tokens (metadata only), billing addresses, and communication preferences. Subscriptions track lifecycle states (incomplete/trialing/active/past_due/paused/canceled/expired) and generate invoices with line items, proration adjustments, credits, and refunds. Workflows include upgrades/downgrades with proration, scheduled plan changes, dunning sequences (retry schedule, grace periods), and cancellation reasons. The platform manages entitlements: features or access levels attached to plans and evaluated per customer or seat. B2B support includes accounts, contacts, seats, and purchase orders. Reporting is driven by stored events: MRR movements, churn, cohort retention, and invoice aging. Webhooks emit deterministic events (invoice.created, payment.failed, subscription.updated) for integration testing. Data is fully synthesizable: prices, invoice numbers, transaction outcomes, and time-based renewals can be simulated with a controllable clock.

name: PerkTrail Loyalty Engine
description: PerkTrail Loyalty Engine powers points, tiers, and rewards for multi-location retailers and online brands. Merchants CRUD programs, earning rules (per dollar, category multipliers, campaign bonuses), redemption rules, reward catalog items (coupon, gift, free shipping), and tier thresholds. Customers are stored with profiles, consent flags, linked identities (email/phone), and wallets (points balance, expiring buckets). Transactions are modeled as ledger entries (earn, redeem, adjust, expire) with references to orders, stores, and campaigns; balances are derived from the ledger for accuracy. Workflows include issuing coupons with constraints (min spend, product/category eligibility, usage limits), referral campaigns (referrer/referee links, reward triggers), and challenges (complete 3 purchases in 30 days). The platform supports returns and fraud controls through reversals, velocity limits, and manual reviews. Admins can manage segments, targeted offers, and messaging schedules (email/SMS payload metadata). APIs enable posting purchases, querying balances, reserving redemptions, and reconciling batches. All data—points, tiers, coupon codes, and timestamps—is synthetic-friendly and suitable for database-driven simulations.

name: VolunteerPulse Scheduling Network
description: VolunteerPulse Scheduling Network helps charities coordinate volunteers across programs, shifts, and locations. Coordinators CRUD organizations, sites, programs, roles (e.g., kitchen prep, phone bank), and shifts with capacity, requirements, and check-in windows. Volunteers CRUD profiles, availability, skills, certifications (metadata + expiry), emergency contacts, and preferred locations. The scheduling workflow supports applications, approvals, waitlists, cancellations, and automatic backfilling. Shift assignments transition through statuses (requested/approved/confirmed/checked_in/no_show/completed) with hour totals calculated from check-in/out records. The system includes background-check steps and training modules tracked as completions (module, score, date) without requiring actual course content. Messaging is modeled as campaigns and reminders with recipient lists and send logs. Coordinators can manage incidents (notes, follow-up tasks), inventory needs for events (items, quantities), and program reports (hours by role, attendance rates, volunteer retention). APIs enable bulk import of volunteers, publishing shifts, booking/unbooking, and generating timesheets for export. All core data—people, shifts, timestamps, statuses, and counts—can be synthesized to simulate realistic operations.

name: ContractGrid Repository & Approvals
description: ContractGrid Repository & Approvals is a contract lifecycle management (CLM) platform focused on metadata, workflows, and approvals. Legal teams CRUD counterparties, contract records, templates, clause library items (title, risk level, fallback text), and negotiation issues. Each contract stores key fields (type, effective date, term, renewal, value, governing law, key obligations) plus document file metadata and version history. Workflows include intake requests (requester, department, urgency), auto-assignment, approval routing (finance/security/legal) with decision logs, and eSignature handoff integration (envelope ids and status). Obligations are tracked as tasks with owners, due dates, reminders, and evidence links. Renewals and compliance are handled via calendar triggers, renewal notices, and alerts for expiring insurance certificates or DPAs. The platform supports redline tracking at the metadata level (issue list, proposed vs accepted clause ids) rather than heavy document content. Search is structured (filter by counterparty, term, status) and fully synthesizable. APIs cover creating contract requests, updating metadata, managing approvals, recording execution, and exporting contract data for reporting and audits.

name: PolicyAccept Portal
description: PolicyAccept Portal manages policy publication and employee acknowledgments for HR and compliance. Admins CRUD policies (title, category, effective date, revision number), policy distributions (audience rules by department/location/role), and acknowledgment tasks with deadlines. Employees are represented as user profiles and employment metadata; acknowledgments record state (not_sent/sent/viewed/accepted/declined/overdue), timestamps, and optional attestations (checkboxes, short text). The system maintains policy versioning so acknowledgments are tied to a specific revision, supporting re-acknowledgment on updates. Workflows include scheduled rollouts, reminder escalations to managers, exception handling (leave of absence, contractors), and reporting for audit readiness (completion rates, overdue lists). Optional quizzes are modeled as question banks and attempt records (score, pass/fail) without needing rich content. Integrations can be simulated by directory sync jobs (create/update users) and webhook events on acceptance/overdue. APIs allow posting new policies, generating distribution batches, querying user compliance, and exporting acknowledgment logs. This scenario is highly database-driven with deterministic statuses and timestamps that are easy to synthesize.

name: MemberSphere Association Manager
description: MemberSphere Association Manager is a membership administration platform for professional associations and clubs. Admins CRUD membership types (student/professional/corporate), pricing, renewal rules, benefits, and eligibility requirements. Members CRUD profiles, credentials, certifications (metadata), and communication preferences. The system tracks membership lifecycle (pending/active/grace/lapsed/suspended) and generates renewal invoices, receipts, and payment logs (tokenized payment metadata). Corporate memberships include organizations, seats, and delegated admins. Benefits are modeled as entitlements (event discounts, resource access flags, directory listing) and can be evaluated via API for downstream systems. The platform supports committees and chapters: CRUD groups, roles, meetings, agendas (metadata), and attendance. A member directory is structured search/filter (location, specialty, status) without requiring content-heavy profiles. Continuing education is tracked via activities and credits with approvals and audits. Workflows include application review, onboarding tasks, renewal reminders, and disciplinary actions with case records. APIs cover member provisioning, entitlement checks, invoice creation, renewals, and exports for accounting or email tools—ideal for synthesized database interactions.

name: MemberSphere Clubs (Memberships + Renewals + Access Control)
description: MemberSphere Clubs is a membership management portal for associations, clubs, and professional societies. Admins CRUD organizations, membership tiers (price, benefits, billing cadence), member profiles, households, and payment methods. Memberships follow lifecycles (pending_payment → active → past_due → grace_period → lapsed/cancelled) with configurable renewal rules, proration, and upgrade/downgrade flows. The platform supports member directories with privacy settings, digital membership cards, and entitlement checks (e.g., access to events, discounts, gated resources). Admins manage invoices, receipts, and failed-payment retries, plus coupons, referral codes, and group memberships for corporate sponsors. Members can update contact info, manage add-ons (locker rental, magazine subscription), and view statements. Audit logs, role-based permissions (staff/treasurer/chapter admin), and webhooks for “member_activated” and “renewal_failed” enable realistic API simulations. Reporting endpoints summarize churn, MRR, cohort retention, and member engagement (check-ins, event attendance metadata) without needing content-heavy features.

name: LoyaltyLoop Rewards (Points + Offers + Partner Earning)
description: LoyaltyLoop Rewards is a configurable loyalty program platform for retail or hospitality brands. Admins CRUD programs, earning rules (per dollar, per visit, bonus days), reward catalogs (coupons, freebies, tier perks), and locations. Customers are entities with wallets (points balance, points ledger), tier status (bronze/silver/gold), and preferences (communication channels, opt-ins). Transactions are modeled as earn and burn events tied to receipts/orders (order_id, subtotal, taxes, eligible items, timestamp), with reversible adjustments for returns and fraud flags. Offers support targeting segments (new members, lapsed 90 days), redemption limits, and expiration rules; redemptions move through states (reserved → redeemed → voided/expired). Partner integrations are simulated via API keys and callback URLs for posting qualifying purchases. Workflows include enrollment, tier evaluation windows, points expiration, and dispute cases (customer challenges missing points). Data is highly synthesizable: store visits, purchase totals, points calculations, and redemption history, making it ideal for CRUD-heavy API environments.

name: PatronPass Media (Creator Subscriptions + Perks Fulfillment)
description: PatronPass Media is a creator membership and perks platform focused on structured access and fulfillment rather than long-form content hosting. Creators CRUD pages, subscription tiers, benefits (digital downloads metadata, early access flags, discount codes), and member rosters. Subscribers CRUD billing profiles, shipping addresses for physical perk fulfillment, and payment methods. Subscription states include trialing/active/past_due/canceled with proration and reactivation flows. Creators can schedule perk drops as fulfillment batches (batch_id, eligible tier, claim window, inventory allocation) and track claims (claimed/packed/shipped) with shipment metadata (carrier, tracking number, delivered status). The platform supports posting short updates and announcements (bounded text fields), but the main API surface is entitlements and fulfillment: verifying a subscriber’s tier, exporting shipping lists, and reconciling failed payments. Admin workflows include disputes, refunds, and chargeback cases; creators can issue tier credits or complimentary months. Webhooks notify downstream systems of tier changes and perk claim events, enabling realistic integration testing without requiring real media files.

name: StreamBundle Hub (OTT Subscriptions + Device Entitlements)
description: StreamBundle Hub is a subscription bundling service for digital streaming access where the core is entitlement management, not content delivery. Operators CRUD subscription plans, bundle components (channels/apps), regions, and pricing. Customers have accounts, household members, and registered devices (device_id, platform, last_seen, max_devices). Purchases create subscriptions with terms, renewal dates, invoices, taxes, and coupon applications. Entitlements are granted per plan and can be overridden (temporary access, parental controls, content rating caps) and are validated via an entitlement-check API that returns allowed apps/channels and expiration timestamps. Workflows include free trials, upgrades/downgrades, plan pauses, failed payment retries, dunning emails (template + schedule), and refunds with prorated credits. Operators can manage partner packages via contract records (rev share %, effective dates) and settlement reports computed from synthetic view-count metadata (counts only, no actual video). Support tools include account recovery, device deauthorization, and fraud flags (too many devices, unusual geography). Everything is CRUD-driven and synthesizable: plans, invoices, device logs, and entitlement states.

name: GiveSpring Donor CRM (Donations + Receipts + Designations)
description: GiveSpring Donor CRM is a donation and donor-management system for nonprofits. Staff CRUD donor profiles, households, communication preferences, and consent flags. Donations can be one-time or recurring with schedules, payment methods (token metadata), and designations (general fund, program A, emergency relief). Donation records support statuses (initiated/authorized/settled/failed/refunded) and automatically generate tax receipts (receipt_id, issue date, deductible amount) and acknowledgements (email/letter template references). Campaigns and appeals are managed as entities with goals, start/end dates, attribution sources (UTM tags), and soft credits for matched gifts or corporate sponsorships.
